pli-tv-kd6:23.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ suppiyo ca upāsako suppiyā ca upāsikā ubhatopasannā honti, dāyakā, kārakā, saṅghupaṭṭhākā.
pli-tv-kd6:23.1.4.eng: At that time in Benares there were two lay-followers, Suppiya and Suppiyā, husband and wife, both with confidence in Buddhism. They were donors and benefactors, and they attended on the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd6:23.1.5.pli: Atha kho suppiyā upāsikā ārāmaṃ gantvā vihārena vihāraṃ pariveṇena pariveṇaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhū pucchati—
pli-tv-kd6:23.1.5.eng: On one occasion Suppiyā went to the monastery. She walked from dwelling to dwelling, from yard to yard, asking the monks,

pli-tv-kd6:23.1.6.eng: “Is anyone sick? What may I bring?”

pli-tv-kd6:23.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena bhikkhunā virecanaṃ pītaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.2.1.eng: Just then a certain monk had drunk a purgative.

pli-tv-kd6:23.2.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu suppiyaṃ upāsikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:23.2.2.eng: He told Suppiyā about this, adding,

pli-tv-kd6:23.2.6.eng: She then returned to her house and told a servant,

pli-tv-kd6:23.2.7.comm: Pavattamaṁsa refers to meat ready for sale, that is, not specially slaughtered. Sp 3.280: Pavattamaṁsanti matassa maṁsaṁ, “Pavattamaṁsa: meat from a dead (animal).”

pli-tv-kd6:23.2.8.pli: “Evaṃ, ayye”ti kho so puriso suppiyāya upāsikāya paṭissuṇitvā kevalakappaṃ bārāṇasiṃ āhiṇḍanto na addasa pavattamaṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:23.2.8.eng: Saying, “Yes, ma’am,” he walked around the whole of Benares, but could not find any.

pli-tv-kd6:23.2.9.pli: Atha kho so puriso yena suppiyā upāsikā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā suppiyaṃ upāsikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:23.2.9.eng: So he returned to Suppiyā and said,

pli-tv-kd6:23.3.2.pli: “tassa kho gilānassa bhikkhuno paṭicchādanīyaṃ alabhantassa ābādho vā abhivaḍḍhissati, kālaṅkiriyā vā bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd6:23.3.2.eng: “If that monk doesn’t get meat broth, his illness will get worse or he’ll die.

pli-tv-kd6:23.3.3.pli: Na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ yāhaṃ paṭissuṇitvā na harāpeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.3.3.eng: Because I’ve already agreed to provide it, it would not be right if I didn’t.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.3.4.pli: Potthanikaṃ gahetvā ūrumaṃsaṃ ukkantitvā dāsiyā adāsi—
pli-tv-kd6:23.3.4.eng: She then took a knife, cut flesh from her own thigh, and gave it to a slave, saying,

pli-tv-kd6:23.3.5.pli: “handa, je, imaṃ maṃsaṃ sampādetvā amukasmiṃ vihāre bhikkhu gilāno, tassa dajjāhi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.3.5.eng: “Prepare this meat and give it to the sick monk in such-and-such a dwelling.

pli-tv-kd6:23.3.6.pli: Yo ca maṃ pucchati, ‘gilānā’ti paṭivedehī”ti uttarāsaṅgena ūruṃ veṭhetvā ovarakaṃ pavisitvā mañcake nipajji.
pli-tv-kd6:23.3.6.eng: If anyone asks for me, tell them I’m sick.” She then wrapped her thigh in her upper robe, entered her bedroom, and lay down on the bed.

pli-tv-kd6:23.4.1.pli: Atha kho suppiyo upāsako gharaṃ gantvā dāsiṃ pucchi—
pli-tv-kd6:23.4.1.eng: When Suppiya returned home, he asked the slave where his wife was.

pli-tv-kd6:23.4.4.pli: Atha kho suppiyo upāsako yena suppiyā upāsikā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā suppiyaṃ upāsikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:23.4.4.eng: He then went to see her,

pli-tv-kd6:23.4.8.pli: Atha kho suppiyā upāsikā suppiyassa upāsakassa etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.4.8.eng: and she told him what had happened.

pli-tv-kd6:23.4.11.pli: Yāva saddhāyaṃ suppiyā pasannā, yatra hi nāma attanopi maṃsāni pariccattāni.
pli-tv-kd6:23.4.11.eng: how much faith and confidence Suppiyā has, as she gives up even her own flesh.

pli-tv-kd6:23.4.12.eng: Is there anything she would not give?”

pli-tv-kd6:23.4.13.pli: haṭṭho udaggo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.4.13.eng: Delighted and joyful he went to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:23.5.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho suppiyo upāsako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:23.5.2.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ, saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.5.2.eng: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.5.3.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:23.5.4.pli: Atha kho suppiyo upāsako bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.5.4.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Suppiya got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:23.5.5.pli: Atha kho suppiyo upāsako tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.5.5.eng: The following morning Suppiya had various kinds of fine foods prepared. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:23.5.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena suppiyassa upāsakassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:23.5.6.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Suppiya’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:23.6.1.pli: Atha kho suppiyo upāsako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.6.1.eng: Suppiya approached the Buddha and bowed down to him.

pli-tv-kd6:23.6.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho suppiyaṃ upāsakaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—“kahaṃ, suppiyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:23.6.2.eng: When the Buddha asked him where Suppiyā was,

pli-tv-kd6:23.6.3.eng: he replied that she was sick.

pli-tv-kd6:23.6.4.eng: “Well then, please tell her to come.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.6.7.pli: Atha kho suppiyo upāsako suppiyaṃ upāsikaṃ pariggahetvā ānesi.

pli-tv-kd6:23.6.8.pli: Tassā saha dassanena bhagavato tāva mahāvaṇo ruḷho ahosi succhavilomajāto.
pli-tv-kd6:23.6.8.eng: The moment Suppiyā saw the Buddha that great wound healed and was perfectly covered with skin and hairs.

pli-tv-kd6:23.7.1.pli: Atha kho suppiyo ca upāsako suppiyā ca upāsikā—

pli-tv-kd6:23.7.2.eng: “The great power and might of the Buddha

pli-tv-kd6:23.7.3.pli: Tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā, yatra hi nāma saha dassanena bhagavato tāva mahāvaṇo ruḷho bhavissati succhavilomajāto”ti—

pli-tv-kd6:23.7.4.pli: haṭṭhā udaggā buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:23.7.4.eng: Delighted and joyful, they personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, they sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:23.7.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā suppiyañca upāsakaṃ suppiyañca upāsikaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.7.5.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching, after which he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:23.8.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd6:23.8.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:23.8.3.pli: Evaṃ vutte, so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—“ahaṃ kho, bhante, suppiyaṃ upāsikaṃ maṃsaṃ viññāpesin”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.8.3.eng: The responsible monk told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:23.9.2.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, appaṭivekkhitvā maṃsaṃ paribhuñjissasi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.9.2.eng: “Foolish man, how can you eat meat without circumspection?

pli-tv-kd6:23.9.5.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:23.9.5.eng: After rebuking him, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:23.9.6.pli: “santi, bhikkhave, manussā saddhā pasannā, tehi attanopi maṃsāni pariccattāni.
pli-tv-kd6:23.9.6.eng: “There are people who have faith and confidence, even to the point of giving up their own flesh.

pli-tv-kd6:23.9.8.eng: If you do, you commit a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd6:23.9.9.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, appaṭivekkhitvā maṃsaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:23.9.9.eng: You shouldn’t eat flesh without being circumspect.

pli-tv-kd6:23.9.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.10.0.eng: 10. Discussion of the prohibition against elephant meat, etc.

pli-tv-kd6:23.10.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rañño hatthī maranti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.10.1.eng: At one time the king’s elephants had died.

pli-tv-kd6:23.10.2.pli: Manussā dubbhikkhe hatthimaṃsaṃ paribhuñjanti, bhikkhūnaṃ piṇḍāya carantānaṃ hatthimaṃsaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.10.2.eng: Because there was a shortage of food, people ate the elephant meat. They also gave elephant meat to monks who were walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd6:23.10.5.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics eat elephant meat?

pli-tv-kd6:23.10.6.pli: Rājaṅgaṃ hatthī, sace rājā jāneyya, na nesaṃ attamano assā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.10.6.eng: Elephants are an attribute of kingship. If the king knew, he would not be pleased with those monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.10.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.11.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rañño assā maranti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.11.1.eng: At one time the king’s horses had died.

pli-tv-kd6:23.11.2.pli: Manussā dubbhikkhe assamaṃsaṃ paribhuñjanti, bhikkhūnaṃ piṇḍāya carantānaṃ assamaṃsaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.11.2.eng: Because there was a shortage of food, people ate the horse meat. They also gave horse meat to monks who were walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd6:23.11.5.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics eat horse meat?

pli-tv-kd6:23.11.6.pli: Rājaṅgaṃ assā, sace rājā jāneyya, na nesaṃ attamano assā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.11.6.eng: Horses are an attribute of kingship. If the king knew, he would not be pleased with those monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.11.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.12.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā dubbhikkhe sunakhamaṃsaṃ paribhuñjanti, bhikkhūnaṃ piṇḍāya carantānaṃ sunakhamaṃsaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.12.1.eng: At one time when there was a shortage of food, people ate dog meat. They also gave dog meat to monks who were walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd6:23.12.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sunakhamaṃsaṃ paribhuñjissanti, jeguccho sunakho paṭikūlo”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.12.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics eat dog meat? Dogs are disgusting and repulsive.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.12.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā dubbhikkhe ahimaṃsaṃ paribhuñjanti, bhikkhūnaṃ piṇḍāya carantānaṃ ahimaṃsaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.1.eng: At one time when there was a shortage of food, people ate snake meat. They also gave snake meat to monks who were walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā ahimaṃsaṃ paribhuñjissanti, jeguccho ahi paṭikūlo”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics eat snake meat? Snakes are disgusting and repulsive.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.5.pli: Supassopi nāgarājā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.5.eng: Even Supassa the king of dragons went to see the Buddha. He bowed down to the Buddha
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.5.comm: The nāgas, here rendered as “dragons”, were supernormal serpents who protected the snakes.

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho supasso nāgarājā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.7.eng: “Sir, there are dragons without faith and confidence.

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.8.eng: They might harm the monks even over small matters.

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.9.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyā ahimaṃsaṃ na paribhuñjeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.9.eng: Please ask the venerables not to eat snake meat.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā supassaṃ nāgarājānaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi …pe… padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.10.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which Supassa bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:23.13.11.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:23.13.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.14.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena luddakā sīhaṃ hantvā sīhamaṃsaṃ paribhuñjanti, bhikkhūnaṃ piṇḍāya carantānaṃ sīhamaṃsaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.14.1.eng: On one occasion hunters killed a lion and ate the lion meat. They also gave lion meat to monks who were walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd6:23.14.2.eng: After eating it, those monks returned to the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd6:23.14.3.eng: And because of the smell of lion meat, lions attacked them.

pli-tv-kd6:23.14.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena luddakā byagghaṃ hantvā …pe…
pli-tv-kd6:23.15.1.eng: On one occasion hunters killed a tiger …

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.4.pli: taracchaṃ hantvā taracchamaṃsaṃ paribhuñjanti, bhikkhūnaṃ piṇḍāya carantānaṃ taracchamaṃsaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:23.15.4.eng: a hyena and ate the hyena meat. They also gave hyena meat to monks who were walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.5.eng: After eating it, those monks returned to the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.6.eng: And because of the smell of hyena meat, hyenas attacked them.

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.8.eng: “You shouldn’t eat tiger meat, leopard meat, bear meat, or hyena meat.

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:23.15.10.eng: The second section for recitation on Suppiyā is finished.

pli-tv-kd6:24.1.0.eng: 11. The allowance for congee and honey balls

pli-tv-kd6:24.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena andhakavindaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi, mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ, aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:24.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Benares for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Andhakavinda together with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:24.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena jānapadā manussā bahuṃ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi sakaṭesu āropetvā buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhā honti—
pli-tv-kd6:24.1.2.eng: On this occasion the country people had loaded large quantities of salt, oil, rice, and fresh food onto carts, and were following behind the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha, thinking,

pli-tv-kd6:24.1.3.pli: “yadā paṭipāṭiṃ labhissāma tadā bhattaṃ karissāmā”ti, pañcamattāni ca vighāsādasatāni.
pli-tv-kd6:24.1.3.eng: “When our turn comes, we’ll prepare a meal.” Five hundred people living on scraps were also following along.

pli-tv-kd6:24.1.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena andhakavindaṃ tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd6:24.1.4.eng: Eventually the Buddha arrived at Andhakavinda and stayed there.

pli-tv-kd6:24.2.1.pli: Atha kho aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa paṭipāṭiṃ alabhantassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd6:24.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a certain brahmin whose turn to offer a meal had not yet come, thought,

pli-tv-kd6:24.2.2.pli: “atītāni kho me dve māsāni buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anubandhantassa ‘yadā paṭipāṭiṃ labhissāmi tadā bhattaṃ karissāmī’ti, na ca me paṭipāṭi labbhati, ahañcamhi ekattako, bahu ca me gharāvāsattho hāyati.
pli-tv-kd6:24.2.2.eng: “I’ve been following the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for two months waiting to offer them a meal, and I’m still waiting. Moreover, I am all alone, and all my household business is being neglected.

pli-tv-kd6:24.2.3.eng: Why don’t I inspect the dining hall
pli-tv-kd6:24.2.3.comm: Bhattagga is literally “a meal house”. The name suggests that the bhattagga was a separate building for eating. They were found both in private houses and in monasteries (Kd 10:4.5.7). Since they were part of houses or a compound of private buildings, “refectory” is not a satisfactory rendering. The fact that kitchens are not mentioned separately may mean that they were part of the bhattagga, except in monasteries. This is supported by a passage at (Bu Pj 3:5.3.1) that mentions a cooking implement, a pestle, being stored in a village bhattagga.

pli-tv-kd6:24.2.5.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo bhattaggaṃ olokento dve nāddasa—
pli-tv-kd6:24.2.5.eng: When he did, he saw that two things were missing:

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.1.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:24.3.1.eng: He then went to Venerable Ānanda and told what he had been thinking,

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.2.pli: “idha me, bho ānanda, paṭipāṭiṃ alabhantassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.3.pli: ‘atītāni kho me dve māsāni buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anubandhantassa, “yadā paṭipāṭiṃ labhissāmi tadā bhattaṃ karissāmī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.4.pli: Na ca me paṭipāṭi labbhati, ahañcamhi ekattako, bahu ca me gharāvāsattho hāyati.

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.7.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bho ānanda, bhattaggaṃ olokento dve nāddasaṃ—

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.9.pli: Sacāhaṃ, bho ānanda, paṭiyādeyyaṃ yāguñca madhugoḷakañca, paṭiggaṇheyya me bhavaṃ gotamo”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:24.3.9.eng: adding, “Good Ānanda, if I were to prepare congee and honey balls, would Good Gotama accept it?”

pli-tv-kd6:24.3.10.eng: “Well, brahmin, let me ask the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.2.eng: who said, “Allow it to be prepared, Ānanda.”

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.3.eng: Ānanda passed the message on to the brahmin.

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.4.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena pahūtaṃ yāguñca madhugoḷakañca paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato upanāmesi—
pli-tv-kd6:24.4.4.eng: The following morning that brahmin prepared much congee and many honey balls and brought it to the Buddha, saying,

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.5.eng: “Good Gotama, please accept the congee and the honey balls.”

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.6.eng: “Well then, brahmin, give it to the monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.7.eng: But being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not accept.

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.8.eng: The Buddha said, “Accept, monks, and eat.”

pli-tv-kd6:24.4.9.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pahūtāya yāguyā ca madhugoḷakena ca sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ dhotahatthaṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:24.4.9.eng: That brahmin then personally served much congee and many honey balls to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, the brahmin sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:24.5.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:24.5.1.eng: And the Buddha said this to him:

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.1.eng: “Brahmin, there are these ten benefits of congee.
pli-tv-kd6:24.6.1.comm: This is a partial parallel to AN 5.207.

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.3.pli: Yāguṃ dento āyuṃ deti, vaṇṇaṃ deti, sukhaṃ deti, balaṃ deti, paṭibhānaṃ deti, yāgu pītā khuddaṃ paṭihanati, pipāsaṃ vineti, vātaṃ anulometi, vatthiṃ sodheti, āmāvasesaṃ pāceti—
pli-tv-kd6:24.6.3.eng: One who gives congee gives life, beauty, happiness, strength, and eloquence; drinking congee stills hunger, allays thirst, gets rid of wind, cleans out the bladder, and helps the digestion of food remnants.

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.5.eng: One who gives congee respectfully at the right time

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.6.eng: To the restrained ones who live on the gifts of others,

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.7.eng: Such a one supplies them with ten things:

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.8.eng: Long life, beauty, happiness, and strength,

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.9.eng: And eloquence, too, one gets from that;

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.10.eng: Hunger, thirst, and wind are removed,

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.11.eng: The bladder is cleaned and the food digested.

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.12.eng: This tonic is praised by the Accomplished One.

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.13.eng: Therefore, for a person looking for happiness—

pli-tv-kd6:24.6.16.eng: It’s appropriate to give congee regularly.”

pli-tv-kd6:24.7.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:24.7.1.eng: The Buddha then got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:24.7.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:24.7.2.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.0.eng: 12. The government official with recently acquired faith

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho manussā bhagavatā kira yāgu anuññātā madhugoḷakañcāti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.1.1.eng: When people heard that the Buddha had allowed congee and honey balls,

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.2.eng: they prepared rice porridge and honey balls early in the morning.
pli-tv-kd6:25.1.2.comm: “Rice porridge” renders bhojjayāgu. Sp 3.283: Bhojjayāgunti yā pavāraṇaṁ janeti, “Bhojjayāgu: what gives rise to satisfaction.” Vin-vn-ṭ 309: Ettha ca bhojjayāgu nāma bahalayāgu, “In this case it is rice porridge that is called bhojjayāgu.”

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.3.pli: Bhikkhū kālasseva bhojjayāguyā dhātā madhugoḷakena ca bhattagge na cittarūpaṃ paribhuñjanti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.1.3.eng: After eating rice porridge and honey balls to their satisfaction in the morning, the monks did not eat as much as they had intended in the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena taruṇapasannena mahāmattena svātanāya buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.1.4.eng: At this time a certain government official who had recently acquired faith in Buddhism had invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for the meal on the following day.

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.5.pli: Atha kho tassa taruṇapasannassa mahāmattassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd6:25.1.6.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ aḍḍhatelasannaṃ bhikkhusatānaṃ aḍḍhatelasāni maṃsapātisatāni paṭiyādeyyaṃ, ekamekassa bhikkhuno ekamekaṃ maṃsapātiṃ upanāmeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.1.6.eng: “Why don’t I prepare twelve hundred and fifty bowls of meat for the twelve hundred and fifty monks? I can then give one bowl to each and every monk.”

pli-tv-kd6:25.2.1.pli: Atha kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā aḍḍhatelasāni ca maṃsapātisatāni, bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.2.1.eng: The following morning that official had various kinds of fine foods prepared, as well as twelve hundred and fifty bowls of meat. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:25.2.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena tassa taruṇapasannassa mahāmattassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:25.2.2.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to that brahmin’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.1.pli: Atha kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto bhattagge bhikkhū parivisati.
pli-tv-kd6:25.3.1.eng: That official then served the monks in the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.2.eng: As he did so, the monks said,

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.4.pli: “Mā kho tumhe, bhante—‘ayaṃ taruṇapasanno mahāmatto’ti—thokaṃ thokaṃ paṭiggaṇhatha.
pli-tv-kd6:25.3.4.eng: “Please don’t say that because I’ve only recently acquired faith in Buddhism.

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.5.pli: Bahuṃ me khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyattaṃ, aḍḍhatelasāni ca maṃsapātisatāni.
pli-tv-kd6:25.3.5.eng: I’ve prepared much food of various kinds, as well as twelve-hundred and fifty bowls of meat.

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.6.eng: I’ll bring one bowl of meat to each and every one of you.

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.7.eng: Venerables, please accept as much as you like.”

pli-tv-kd6:25.3.8.pli: “Na kho mayaṃ, āvuso, etaṅkāraṇā thokaṃ thokaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma, api ca mayaṃ kālasseva bhojjayāguyā dhātā madhugoḷakena ca. Tena mayaṃ thokaṃ thokaṃ paṭiggaṇhāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.3.8.eng: “We’re not taking so little because of that, but because we ate rice porridge and honey balls to our satisfaction early in the morning.”

pli-tv-kd6:25.4.1.pli: Atha kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-kd6:25.4.1.eng: The official complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd6:25.4.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā mayā nimantitā aññassa bhojjayāguṃ paribhuñjissanti, na cāhaṃ paṭibalo yāvadatthaṃ dātun”ti
pli-tv-kd6:25.4.2.eng: “When the venerables have been invited by me, how can they eat someone else’s rice porridge? Am I incapable of giving them as much as they like?”

pli-tv-kd6:25.4.3.pli: kupito anattamano āsādanāpekkho bhikkhūnaṃ patte pūrento agamāsi—“bhuñjatha vā haratha vā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.4.3.eng: Angry and aiming to criticize, he walked around filling the monks’ almsbowls, saying, “Eat it or take it away.”

pli-tv-kd6:25.4.4.pli: Atha kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:25.4.4.eng: When he had personally served the various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha, and the Buddha had finished his meal, the official sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:25.4.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho taṃ taruṇapasannaṃ mahāmattaṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:25.4.5.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.1.pli: Atha kho tassa taruṇapasannassa mahāmattassa acirapakkantassa bhagavato ahudeva kukkuccaṃ, ahu vippaṭisāro—
pli-tv-kd6:25.5.1.eng: Soon after the Buddha had left, that official felt anxiety and remorse, thinking,

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.2.pli: “alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ;

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.3.pli: yohaṃ kupito anattamano āsādanāpekkho bhikkhūnaṃ patte pūrento agamāsiṃ—‘bhuñjatha vā haratha vā’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.4.pli: Kiṃ nu kho mayā bahuṃ pasutaṃ puññaṃ vā apuññaṃ vā”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:25.5.4.eng: I wonder, did I make much merit or demerit?”

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.5.pli: Atha kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:25.5.5.eng: He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:25.5.6.eng: and told him what he had been thinking, adding,

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.7.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, acirapakkantassa bhagavato ahudeva kukkuccaṃ, ahu vippaṭisāro

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.8.pli: ‘alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ;

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.9.pli: yohaṃ kupito anattamano āsādanāpekkho bhikkhūnaṃ patte pūrento agamāsiṃ—bhuñjatha vā haratha vāti.

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.10.pli: Kiṃ nu kho mayā bahuṃ pasutaṃ, puññaṃ vā apuññaṃ vā’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:25.5.11.pli: Kiṃ nu kho mayā, bhante, bahuṃ pasutaṃ, puññaṃ vā apuññaṃ vā”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:25.5.11.eng: “I wonder, sir, did I make much merit or demerit?”

pli-tv-kd6:25.6.1.pli: “Yadaggena tayā, āvuso, svātanāya buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito tadaggena te bahuṃ puññaṃ pasutaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:25.6.1.eng: “When you invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for a meal on the following day, you made much merit.

pli-tv-kd6:25.6.2.pli: Yadaggena te ekamekena bhikkhunā ekamekaṃ sitthaṃ paṭiggahitaṃ tadaggena te bahuṃ puññaṃ pasutaṃ, saggā te āraddhā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.6.2.eng: When each and every monk received rice from you, you made much merit. You are heading for heaven.”

pli-tv-kd6:25.6.3.pli: Atha kho so taruṇapasanno mahāmatto—“lābhā kira me, suladdhaṃ kira me, bahuṃ kira mayā puññaṃ pasutaṃ, saggā kira me āraddhā”ti—

pli-tv-kd6:25.6.4.pli: haṭṭho udaggo uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:25.6.4.eng: he was joyful and elated. He got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:25.7.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd6:25.7.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:25.7.2.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū aññatra nimantitā aññassa bhojjayāguṃ paribhuñjantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:25.7.2.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks who had been invited for a meal ate someone else’s rice porridge beforehand?”

pli-tv-kd6:25.7.5.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā aññatra nimantitā aññassa bhojjayāguṃ paribhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-kd6:25.7.5.eng: “How can those foolish men eat someone else’s congee beforehand when they have been invited for a meal?

pli-tv-kd6:25.7.7.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:25.7.7.eng: After rebuking them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:25.7.8.pli: “na, bhikkhave, aññatra nimantitena aññassa bhojjayāgu paribhuñjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd6:25.7.8.eng: “When you have been invited to a meal, you shouldn’t eat someone else’s rice porridge beforehand.

pli-tv-kd6:25.7.9.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā andhakavinde yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena rājagahaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi, mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ, aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Andhakavinda for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Rājagaha together with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:26.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena belaṭṭho kaccāno rājagahā andhakavindaṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti, pañcamattehi sakaṭasatehi, sabbeheva guḷakumbhapūrehi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.1.2.eng: Just then Belaṭṭha Kaccāna was traveling from Rājagaha to Andhakavinda with five hundred carts, all of them filled with jars of sugar.

pli-tv-kd6:26.1.3.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā belaṭṭhaṃ kaccānaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ, disvāna maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.1.3.eng: When the Buddha saw Belaṭṭha Kaccāna coming, he stepped off the road and sat down at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd6:26.2.1.pli: Atha kho belaṭṭho kaccāno yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.2.1.eng: Belaṭṭha Kaccāna went up to the Buddha, bowed,

pli-tv-kd6:26.2.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:26.2.3.pli: “icchāmahaṃ, bhante, ekamekassa bhikkhuno ekamekaṃ guḷakumbhaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.2.3.eng: “Sir, I would like to give one jar of sugar to each and every monk.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.2.4.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, ekaṃyeva guḷakumbhaṃ āharā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.2.4.eng: “Well then, Kaccāna, just bring one jar of sugar.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.2.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā ekaṃyeva guḷakumbhaṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.2.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he got a jar of sugar, returned to the Buddha, and said,

pli-tv-kd6:26.2.8.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, bhikkhūnaṃ guḷaṃ dehī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.1.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā bhikkhūnaṃ guḷaṃ datvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.1.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he did just that. He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.2.pli: “dinno, bhante, bhikkhūnaṃ guḷo, bahu cāyaṃ guḷo avasiṭṭho.
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.2.eng: “I’ve given sugar to the monks, but there’s much left over.

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.3.eng: What should I do with that?”

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.4.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, bhikkhūnaṃ guḷaṃ yāvadatthaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.4.eng: “Give the monks as much sugar as they need.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā bhikkhūnaṃ guḷaṃ yāvadatthaṃ datvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he did as requested. He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.6.pli: “dinno, bhante, bhikkhūnaṃ guḷo yāvadattho, bahu cāyaṃ guḷo avasiṭṭho.
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.6.eng: “I’ve given the monks as much sugar as they need, but there’s much left over.

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.7.eng: What should I do with that?”

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.8.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, bhikkhū guḷehi santappehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.8.eng: “Give the monks as much sugar as they want.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.9.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā bhikkhū guḷehi santappesi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.9.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he again did as requested.

pli-tv-kd6:26.3.10.pli: Ekacce bhikkhū pattepi pūresuṃ parissāvanānipi thavikāyopi pūresuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:26.3.10.eng: Some monks filled their almsbowls and even their water filters and bags.

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.1.pli: Atha kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhikkhū guḷehi santappetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.4.1.eng: When he was finished, he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.2.pli: “santappitā, bhante, bhikkhū guḷehi, bahu cāyaṃ guḷo avasiṭṭho.
pli-tv-kd6:26.4.2.eng: “I’ve given the monks as much sugar as they want, but there’s much left over.

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.3.eng: What should I do with that?”

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.4.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, vighāsādānaṃ guḷaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.4.4.eng: “Give to those who live on scraps.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā vighāsādānaṃ guḷaṃ datvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.4.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he again did as requested. He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.6.pli: “dinno, bhante, vighāsādānaṃ guḷo, bahu cāyaṃ guḷo avasiṭṭho.
pli-tv-kd6:26.4.6.eng: “I’ve given them sugar, but there’s much left over.

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.7.eng: What should I do with that?”

pli-tv-kd6:26.4.8.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, vighāsādānaṃ guḷaṃ yāvadatthaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.4.8.eng: “Give them as much sugar as they need.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.5.1.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā vighāsādānaṃ guḷaṃ yāvadatthaṃ datvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.5.1.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he again did as requested. He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.5.2.pli: “dinno, bhante, vighāsādānaṃ guḷo yāvadattho, bahu cāyaṃ guḷo avasiṭṭho.
pli-tv-kd6:26.5.2.eng: “I’ve given them as much sugar as they need, but there’s much left over.

pli-tv-kd6:26.5.3.eng: What should I do with that?”

pli-tv-kd6:26.5.4.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, vighāsāde guḷehi santappehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.5.4.eng: “Give them as much sugar as they want.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.5.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā vighāsāde guḷehi santappesi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.5.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he once again did as requested.

pli-tv-kd6:26.5.6.pli: Ekacce vighāsādā kolambepi ghaṭepi pūresuṃ, piṭakānipi ucchaṅgepi pūresuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:26.5.6.eng: Some of those who lived on scraps filled basins, waterpots, and baskets, and some even their laps.

pli-tv-kd6:26.6.1.pli: Atha kho belaṭṭho kaccāno vighāsāde guḷehi santappetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.6.1.eng: When he was finished, he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.6.2.pli: “santappitā, bhante, vighāsādā guḷehi, bahu cāyaṃ guḷo avasiṭṭho.
pli-tv-kd6:26.6.2.eng: “I’ve given them as much sugar as they want, but there’s much left over.

pli-tv-kd6:26.6.3.eng: What should I do with that?”

pli-tv-kd6:26.6.4.pli: “Nāhaṃ taṃ, kaccāna, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yassa so guḷo paribhutto sammā pariṇāmaṃ gaccheyya, aññatra tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.
pli-tv-kd6:26.6.4.eng: “Kaccāna, I don’t see anyone in this world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, in this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, who would be able to properly digest that sugar except a Buddha or his disciple.

pli-tv-kd6:26.6.5.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, kaccāna, taṃ guḷaṃ appaharite vā chaḍḍehi, appāṇake vā udake opilāpehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.6.5.eng: So discard that sugar where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.”
pli-tv-kd6:26.6.5.comm: Appaharita, literally, “few green plants”. Bu Pc 19:2.1.14: Haritaṁ nāma pubbaṇṇaṁ aparaṇṇaṁ, “Harita means: vegetables and grains.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.6.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho belaṭṭho kaccāno bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā taṃ guḷaṃ appāṇake udake opilāpeti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.6.6.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he dumped that sugar in water without life.

pli-tv-kd6:26.7.1.pli: Atha kho so guḷo udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati padhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.
pli-tv-kd6:26.7.1.eng: As he did so, that sugar hissed, sputtered, fumed, and smoked—

pli-tv-kd6:26.7.2.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma phālo divasaṃsantatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati padhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati;
pli-tv-kd6:26.7.2.eng: just like a plowshare heated the whole day hisses, sputters, fumes, and smokes when dropped in water.

pli-tv-kd6:26.7.3.pli: evameva so guḷo udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati padhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.

pli-tv-kd6:26.7.4.pli: Atha kho belaṭṭho kaccāno saṃviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.7.4.eng: Belaṭṭha Kaccāna was awestruck, with goose bumps all over. He approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd6:26.8.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnassa kho belaṭṭhassa kaccānassa bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:26.8.1.eng: The Buddha then gave him a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd6:26.8.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd6:26.8.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd6:26.8.3.pli: Yadā bhagavā aññāsi belaṭṭhaṃ kaccānaṃ kallacittaṃ, muducittaṃ, vinīvaraṇacittaṃ, udaggacittaṃ, pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā, taṃ pakāsesi …pe…
pli-tv-kd6:26.8.3.eng: When the Buddha knew that his mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd6:26.8.4.pli: evameva belaṭṭhassa kaccānassa tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd6:26.8.4.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly, so too, while he was sitting right there, Belaṭṭha Kaccāna experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd6:26.8.5.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd6:26.9.1.pli: Atha kho belaṭṭho kaccāno diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:26.9.1.eng: He had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. He had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:26.9.3.eng: Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

pli-tv-kd6:26.9.4.pli: evamevaṃ kho bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
pli-tv-kd6:26.9.4.eng: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

pli-tv-kd6:26.9.5.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-kd6:26.9.5.eng: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:26.9.6.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇagatan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:26.9.6.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd6:27.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena rājagahaṃ tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd6:27.1.1.eng: The Buddha then continued wandering toward Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd6:27.1.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-kd6:27.1.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-kd6:27.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe guḷo ussanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:27.1.3.eng: At that time there was an abundance of sugar in Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd6:27.1.5.eng: “The Buddha has only allowed sugar for the sick,”

pli-tv-kd6:27.1.6.eng: and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not eat it.

pli-tv-kd6:27.1.8.eng: “I allow you to take sugar when you’re sick and sugar mixed in water when you’re not.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena pāṭaligāmo tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi, mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:28.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Pāṭaligāma with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.
pli-tv-kd6:28.1.1.comm: Sections 14 to 18 are essentially the same as sections 5–8 and 11 in the Mahāparinibbāna Sutta at DN 16:1.19.1–2.3.10 and DN 16:2.14.1–2.19.9.

pli-tv-kd6:28.1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena pāṭaligāmo tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd6:28.1.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he stayed there.

pli-tv-kd6:28.1.3.eng: When the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma heard

pli-tv-kd6:28.1.5.pli: Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:28.1.5.eng: they went to see him, bowed, and sat down on one side.

pli-tv-kd6:28.1.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho pāṭaligāmike upāsake bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi, samādapesi, samuttejesi, sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd6:28.1.6.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd6:28.2.1.pli: Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:28.2.1.eng: They then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:28.2.2.pli: “adhivāsetu no, bhante, bhagavā āvasathāgāraṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:28.2.2.eng: “Sir, please visit our guesthouse together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.2.3.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:28.2.4.pli: Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yena āvasathāgāraṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā sabbasanthariṃ āvasathāgāraṃ santharitvā, āsanāni paññapetvā, udakamaṇikaṃ patiṭṭhāpetvā, telapadīpaṃ āropetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:28.2.4.eng: Knowing that he had consented, they got up from their seats, bowed down, and circumambulated him with their right sides toward him. They then went to the guesthouse, spread mats on the floor, prepared seats, put out a large waterpot, and hung up an oil lamp, after which they returned to the Buddha, bowed,

pli-tv-kd6:28.3.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd6:28.3.6.eng: adding, “Sir, please come when you’re ready.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.3.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena yena āvasathāgāraṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṃ pavisitvā majjhimaṃ thambhaṃ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:28.3.7.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the guesthouse together with the Sangha of monks. He washed his feet, entered the guesthouse, and sat down facing east, leaning on the central pillar.

pli-tv-kd6:28.3.8.pli: Bhikkhusaṅghopi kho pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṃ pavisitvā pacchimaṃ bhittiṃ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi, bhagavantaṃyeva purakkhatvā.
pli-tv-kd6:28.3.8.eng: The monks washed their feet too, entered the guesthouse, and sat down facing east with the Buddha in front of them, leaning against the western wall.

pli-tv-kd6:28.3.9.pli: Pāṭaligāmikāpi kho upāsakā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṃ pavisitvā puratthimaṃ bhittiṃ nissāya pacchimābhimukhā nisīdiṃsu, bhagavantaṃyeva purakkhatvā.
pli-tv-kd6:28.3.9.eng: The lay followers of Pāṭaligāma followed suit and sat down facing west with the Buddha in front of them, leaning against the eastern wall.

pli-tv-kd6:28.3.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:28.3.10.eng: The Buddha then addressed those lay followers:

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.1.eng: “There are these five dangers for one who is immoral because of failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.3.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno pamādādhikaraṇaṃ mahatiṃ bhogajāniṃ nigacchati.
pli-tv-kd6:28.4.3.eng: Because of heedlessness, they lose much wealth.

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.5.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, dussīlassa sīlavipannassa pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.7.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno yaññadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati, yadi khattiyaparisaṃ, yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ, yadi gahapatiparisaṃ, yadi samaṇaparisaṃ, avisārado upasaṅkamati maṅkubhūto.
pli-tv-kd6:28.4.7.eng: Whenever they come to a gathering of people—whether a gathering of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or monastics—they are shy and timid.

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.9.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno sammūḷho kālaṃ karoti.

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.11.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
pli-tv-kd6:28.4.11.eng: After death, they are reborn in a lower realm.

pli-tv-kd6:28.4.13.pli: Ime kho, gahapatayo, pañca ādīnavā dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.1.eng: There are these five benefits for one who is moral because of success in morality.

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.3.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno appamādādhikaraṇaṃ mahantaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ adhigacchati.
pli-tv-kd6:28.5.3.eng: Because of heedfulness, they gain much wealth.

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.5.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, sīlavato sīlasampannassa kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.7.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno yaññadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati, yadi khattiyaparisaṃ, yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ, yadi gahapatiparisaṃ, yadi samaṇaparisaṃ, visārado upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.
pli-tv-kd6:28.5.7.eng: Whenever they come to a gathering of people—whether a gathering of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or monastics—they are confident and self-assured.

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.9.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno asammūḷho kālaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-kd6:28.5.9.eng: They die with a clear mind.

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.11.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
pli-tv-kd6:28.5.11.eng: After death, they are reborn in heaven.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.5.13.pli: Ime kho, gahapatayo, pañca ānisaṃsā sīlavato sīlasampadāyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:28.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahudeva rattiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uyyojesi—
pli-tv-kd6:28.6.1.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them by teaching for much of the night. He then dismissed them, saying,

pli-tv-kd6:28.6.4.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti, kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:28.6.4.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right sides toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantesu pāṭaligāmikesu upāsakesu suññāgāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.1.eng: Soon after the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma had left, the Buddha entered an empty cubicle.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.1.comm: Suññāgāra normally means solitude or an empty dwelling, but here the context suggests another meaning is intended. DN-a 1.151, commenting on the parallel at DN 16:1.25.4, says: Suññāgāranti pāṭiyekkaṁ suññāgāraṁ nāma natthi, tattheva pana ekapasse sāṇipākārena parikkhipitvā – “idha satthā vissamissatī”ti mañcakaṁ paññapesuṁ, “Suññāgāra: it is not a distinct (dwelling) that is called a suññāgāra. But they prepared a bed to one side right there, having surrounded it with a curtain, thinking, ‘The Teacher will rest here.’”

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṃ māpenti vajjīnaṃ paṭibāhāya.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.2.1.eng: At that time Sunidha and Vassakāra, the government officials of Magadha, were building a fortress at Pāṭaligāma to defend against the Vajjians.

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.3.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sambahulā devatāyo pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyo.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.3.eng: The Buddha got up early in the morning and, with his superhuman and purified clairvoyance, he saw a number of gods taking possession of sites around Pāṭaligāma.

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.4.pli: Yasmiṃ padese mahesakkhā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, mahesakkhānaṃ tattha rājūnaṃ rājamahāmattānaṃ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.4.eng: And wherever powerful gods took possession of a site was where powerful kings and government officials tended to build their houses.

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.5.pli: Yasmiṃ padese majjhimā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, majjhimānaṃ tattha rājūnaṃ rājamahāmattānaṃ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.5.eng: Wherever gods of middle standing took possession of a site was where the kings and government officials of middle standing tended to build their houses.

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.6.pli: Yasmiṃ padese nīcā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, nīcānaṃ tattha rājūnaṃ rājamahāmattānaṃ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.6.eng: Wherever the lower ranked gods took possession of a site was where the lower ranked kings and government officials tended to build their houses.

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:28.7.7.eng: The Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,

pli-tv-kd6:28.7.8.pli: “ke nu kho te, ānanda, pāṭaligāme nagaraṃ māpentī”ti?

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.1.pli: “Sunidhavassakārā, bhante, magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṃ māpenti vajjīnaṃ paṭibāhāyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.2.eng: “They are building the fortress, Ānanda, as if they had consulted with the Tāvatiṁsa gods.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.3.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṃ māpenti vajjīnaṃ paṭibāhāya.

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.4.pli: Idhāhaṃ, ānanda, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya addasaṃ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sambahulā devatāyo pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyo.
pli-tv-kd6:28.8.4.eng: The Buddha told Ānanda what he had seen,

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.5.pli: Yasmiṃ padese mahesakkhā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, mahesakkhānaṃ tattha rājūnaṃ rājamahāmattānaṃ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.6.pli: Yasmiṃ padese majjhimā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, majjhimānaṃ tattha rājūnaṃ rājamahāmattānaṃ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.7.pli: Yasmiṃ padese nīcā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, nīcānaṃ tattha rājūnaṃ rājamahāmattānaṃ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.8.pli: Yāvatā, ānanda, ariyaṃ āyatanaṃ, yāvatā vaṇippatho, idaṃ agganagaraṃ bhavissati pāṭaliputtaṃ puṭabhedanaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:28.8.8.eng: adding, “As far, Ānanda, as the extent of the Indian realm, as far as the routes of commerce, Pāṭaliputta will be the chief city, the destination for merchandise.
pli-tv-kd6:28.8.8.comm: For puṭabhedana, see Oskar von Hinüber, “Hoary Past and Hazy Memory”, p. 203.

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.9.pli: Pāṭaliputtassa kho, ānanda, tayo antarāyā bhavissanti—
pli-tv-kd6:28.8.9.eng: And there will be three dangers for Pāṭaliputta:

pli-tv-kd6:28.8.10.pli: aggito vā udakato vā abbhantarato vā mithubhedā”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:28.9.1.pli: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu, sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:28.9.1.eng: Sunidha and Vassakāra then went to the Buddha and exchanged pleasantries with him,

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.2.pli: “adhivāsetu no bhavaṃ gotamo ajjatanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:28.10.2.eng: “Please accept tomorrow’s meal from us together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.3.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.4.pli: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:28.10.4.eng: Knowing that he had consented, they left.

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.5.pli: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesuṃ—“kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:28.10.5.eng: Having had various kinds of fine foods prepared, they had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sunidhavassakārānaṃ magadhamahāmattānaṃ parivesanā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:28.10.6.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Sunidha and Vassakāra’s meal offering where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.7.pli: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:28.10.7.eng: Sunidha and Vassakāra then personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, they sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:28.10.8.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho sunidhavassakāre magadhamahāmatte bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi—
pli-tv-kd6:28.10.8.eng: And the Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses:

pli-tv-kd6:28.11.8.eng: They return the favor to you.

pli-tv-kd6:28.11.9.eng: And they have compassion for you,

pli-tv-kd6:28.11.10.eng: As a mother for her own child.

pli-tv-kd6:28.11.11.eng: The person the gods have compassion for

pli-tv-kd6:28.11.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sunidhavassakāre magadhamahāmatte imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:28.11.13.eng: The Buddha then got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhā honti—
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.1.eng: But Sunidha and Vassakāra followed behind him, thinking,

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.2.pli: “yenajja samaṇo gotamo dvārena nikkhamissati, taṃ gotamadvāraṃ nāma bhavissati;
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.2.eng: “Whatever gate the ascetic Gotama leaves from, we’ll name the Gotama Gate.

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.3.pli: yena titthena gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttarissati, taṃ gotamatitthaṃ nāma bhavissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.3.eng: Whatever ford he uses to cross the river Ganges, we’ll name the Gotama Ford.”

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena dvārena nikkhami, taṃ gotamadvāraṃ nāma ahosi.
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.4.eng: And so the gate through which he left was named the Gotama Gate.

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena gaṅgā nadī tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.5.eng: The Buddha then went to the river Ganges.

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena gaṅgā nadī pūrā hoti samatittikā kākapeyyā.
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.6.eng: At that time the river was full to the brim.

pli-tv-kd6:28.12.7.pli: Manussā aññe nāvaṃ pariyesanti, aññe uḷumpaṃ pariyesanti, aññe kullaṃ bandhanti orā pāraṃ gantukāmā.
pli-tv-kd6:28.12.7.eng: Among the people who wanted to cross, some were looking for a boat, some for a barge, and some were putting together a raft.

pli-tv-kd6:28.13.1.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā te manusse aññe nāvaṃ pariyesante, aññe uḷumpaṃ pariyesante, aññe kullaṃ bandhante orā pāraṃ gantukāme, disvāna seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva kho—gaṅgāya nadiyā orimatīre antarahito pārimatīre paccuṭṭhāsi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:28.13.1.eng: The Buddha saw this. Then, just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm, the Buddha disappeared from the near shore of the river and reappeared on the far shore together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:28.13.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd6:28.13.2.eng: Seeing the significance of this, the Buddha uttered a heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd6:28.13.3.eng: “Whoever crosses the flowing mass of water,

pli-tv-kd6:28.13.4.eng: They build a bridge, leaving the water behind.
pli-tv-kd6:28.13.4.comm: I understand pallalāni as a poetic term for any body of water.

pli-tv-kd6:28.13.5.eng: While ordinary people put together a raft,

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.0.eng: 16. Discussion of the truths at Koṭigāma

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena koṭigāmo tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd6:29.1.1.eng: The Buddha then went to Koṭigāma

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.4.pli: “catunnaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasaccānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañceva tumhākañca.
pli-tv-kd6:29.1.4.eng: “It’s because of not awakening to or penetrating these four noble truths that you and I have wandered on and transmigrated for such a long time:

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.6.pli: Dukkhassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañceva tumhākañca.

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.7.eng: the noble truth of the origin of suffering,

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.8.eng: the noble truth of the end of suffering,

pli-tv-kd6:29.1.9.pli: dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañceva tumhākañca.
pli-tv-kd6:29.1.9.eng: the noble truth of the path leading to the end of suffering.

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.1.pli: Tayidaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ anubuddhaṃ paṭividdhaṃ, dukkhasamudayaṃ ariyasaccaṃ anubuddhaṃ paṭividdhaṃ, dukkhanirodhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ anubuddhaṃ paṭividdhaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā ariyasaccaṃ anubuddhaṃ paṭividdhaṃ, ucchinnā bhavataṇhā, khīṇā bhavanetti, natthi dāni punabbhavoti.
pli-tv-kd6:29.2.1.eng: But now, monks, the noble truth of suffering has been awakened to and penetrated, likewise the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the end of suffering, and the noble truth of the path leading to the end of suffering. Craving for existence has been cut off; the passage to existence has been destroyed; now there is no further existence.

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.4.eng: You have transmigrated for a long time

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.5.eng: Among the various kinds of rebirth.

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.6.eng: But now they have been seen,

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.7.eng: The passage to existence has been destroyed,

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.8.eng: The root of suffering has been cut off,

pli-tv-kd6:29.2.9.eng: And there is no further existence.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.1.0.eng: 17–18. The account of Ambapālī and the Licchavīs

pli-tv-kd6:30.1.2.eng: that the Buddha had arrived at Koṭigāma.

pli-tv-kd6:30.1.3.pli: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhadraṃ bhadraṃ yānaṃ abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi yānehi vesāliyā niyyāsi bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
pli-tv-kd6:30.1.3.eng: She had her best carriages harnessed, mounted one of them, and left Vesālī to visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:30.1.4.pli: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā, yānā paccorohitvā, pattikāva yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:30.1.4.eng: She went by carriage as far as the ground would allow, dismounted, and then approached the Buddha on foot. After bowing down to the Buddha, she sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:30.2.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho ambapāliṃ gaṇikaṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd6:30.2.1.eng: and the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd6:30.2.2.pli: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:30.2.2.eng: She then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:30.2.3.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.2.3.eng: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.2.4.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:30.2.5.pli: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:30.2.5.eng: Knowing that he had consented, she got up from her seat, bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:30.3.2.eng: heard that the Buddha had arrived at Koṭigāma.

pli-tv-kd6:30.3.3.pli: Atha kho vesālikā licchavī bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhadraṃ bhadraṃ yānaṃ abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi yānehi vesāliyā niyyāsuṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
pli-tv-kd6:30.3.3.eng: They had their best carriages harnessed, mounted one of them, and left Vesālī to visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:30.3.4.pli: Appekacce licchavī nīlā honti nīlavaṇṇā nīlavatthā nīlālaṅkārā, appekacce licchavī pītā honti pītavaṇṇā pītavatthā pītālaṅkārā, appekacce licchavī lohitā honti lohitavaṇṇā lohitavatthā lohitālaṅkārā, appekacce licchavī odātā honti odātavaṇṇā odātavatthā odātālaṅkārā.
pli-tv-kd6:30.3.4.eng: Some of them wore blue, with blue makeup, blue clothes, and blue ornaments, and likewise, some of them wore yellow, some red, and some white.

pli-tv-kd6:30.3.5.pli: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā daharānaṃ daharānaṃ licchavīnaṃ īsāya īsaṃ yugena yugaṃ cakkena cakkaṃ akkhena akkhaṃ paṭivaṭṭesi.
pli-tv-kd6:30.3.5.eng: When Ambapālī met the young Licchavīs, she turned her carriage around and drove up next to them, pole to pole, yoke to yoke, wheel to wheel, axle to axle.

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.1.pli: Atha kho te licchavī ambapāliṃ gaṇikaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.1.eng: The Licchavīs said, “What on earth are you doing?”

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.2.pli: “kissa, je ambapāli, daharānaṃ daharānaṃ licchavīnaṃ īsāya īsaṃ yugena yugaṃ cakkena cakkaṃ akkhena akkhaṃ paṭivaṭṭesī”ti?

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.3.pli: “Tathā hi pana mayā, ayyaputtā, svātanāya buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.3.eng: and she replied, “I’m doing this, sirs, because I’ve invited the Buddha and the Sangha of monks for tomorrow’s meal!”

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.4.pli: “Dehi, je ambapāli, amhākaṃ etaṃ bhattaṃ satasahassenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.4.eng: “We’ll give you a hundred thousand for this meal, Ambapālī.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.5.pli: “Sacepi me, ayyaputtā, vesāliṃ sāhāraṃ dajjeyyātha, neva dajjāhaṃ taṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.5.eng: “Even if you gave me the whole of Vesālī and the adjoining countryside, I would not give you this meal.”
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.5.comm: Vesāliṁ sāhāraṁ, literally, “Vesālī with its support”. Sp 3.289: Sāhāraṁ dajjeyyāthāti sajanapadaṁ dadeyyātha, “Sāhāraṁ dajjeyyātha means you should give me (Vesālī) together with the country.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.6.pli: Atha kho te licchavī aṅguliṃ phoṭesuṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.6.eng: The Licchavīs snapped their fingers in dismay, saying,

pli-tv-kd6:30.4.7.pli: “jitamha vata bho ambakāya, parājitamha vata bho ambakāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.4.7.eng: “Dammit, we’ve been beaten by the mango woman!”

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.1.pli: Atha kho te licchavī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.1.eng: And they continued on their way to the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.2.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā te licchavī dūratova āgacchante, disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.2.eng: When the Buddha saw them coming, he said to the monks,

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.3.pli: “yehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi devā tāvatiṃsā adiṭṭhapubbā, oloketha, bhikkhave, licchavīparisaṃ;
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.3.eng: “Those of you who haven’t seen the Tāvatiṁsa gods, look at the Licchavīs.

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.5.eng: The Licchavīs are similar to the Tāvatiṁsa gods.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.6.pli: Atha kho te licchavī yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikāva yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.6.eng: The Licchavīs went by carriage as far as the ground would allow, dismounted, and then approached the Buddha on foot.

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.7.eng: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.8.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te licchavī bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.8.eng: and the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.9.pli: Atha kho te licchavī, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.9.eng: They then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.10.pli: “adhivāsetu no, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.10.eng: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from us together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.11.eng: “I have already accepted tomorrow’s meal from Ambapālī.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.12.pli: Atha kho te licchavī aṅguliṃ phoṭesuṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.12.eng: The Licchavīs snapped their fingers in dismay,

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.13.pli: “jitamha vata bho ambakāya, parājitamha vata bho ambakāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.13.eng: saying, “Dammit, we’ve been beaten by the mango woman.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.5.14.pli: Atha kho te licchavī bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:30.5.14.eng: After rejoicing in the Buddha’s words, they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right sides toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā koṭigāme yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena nātikā tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Koṭigāma for as long as he liked, he went to Nātikā,

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjakāvasathe.
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.2.eng: where he stayed in the brick guesthouse.

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.3.pli: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā tassā rattiyā accayena sake ārāme paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.3.eng: The following morning Ambapālī had various kinds of fine foods prepared in her own park. She then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena ambapāliyā gaṇikāya parivesanā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.4.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Ambapālī’s meal offering where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.5.pli: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.5.eng: Ambapālī personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, she sat down to one side and said,

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.6.eng: “Sir, I give this mango grove to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ambapāliṃ gaṇikaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena mahāvanaṃ tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.8.eng: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening her with a teaching, he got up from his seat and went to the Great Wood near Vesālī,

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.9.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:30.6.9.eng: where he stayed in the hall with the peaked roof.

pli-tv-kd6:30.6.10.eng: The third section for recitation on the Licchavīs is finished.

pli-tv-kd6:31.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī sandhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.1.1.eng: On one occasion a number of well-known Licchavīs were seated together in the public hall, praising the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha in many ways.
pli-tv-kd6:31.1.1.comm: The santhāgāra seems to have been a multi-purpose building. In the present context it is used as a meeting place, the exact nature of the meeting not being spelled out. Other contexts show that the santhāgāra was used for a number of purposes. At MN 51:10.3 it is used as a place to perform a ritual; from MN 53:2.1 and similar contexts we can deduce from the word anajjhāvuṭṭha, “not (previously) lived in”, that it was used as a place of lodging; at DN 3:1.13.4 the Sakyans were enjoying themselves in their santhāgāra; according to DN 16:5.20.1 and other suttas, the official meetings were held there; and at SN 56.45:1.3 the Licchavīs were practicing archery in the santhāgāra. By contrast the sabhā seems to have been used exclusively for official meetings. As a consequence I translate santhāgāra as “public hall” and sabhā as “public meeting hall”. Most of this section is parallel to AN 8.12.

pli-tv-kd6:31.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sīho senāpati nigaṇṭhasāvako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.1.2.eng: Sīha the general, a disciple of the Jains, was seated in that gathering.

pli-tv-kd6:31.1.4.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, tathā hime abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī sandhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.1.4.eng: “No doubt that Buddha is perfected, a fully Awakened One, since these well-known Licchavīs praise the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha in this way.

pli-tv-kd6:31.1.5.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.1.5.eng: Why don’t I go and visit that Buddha?”

pli-tv-kd6:31.2.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:31.2.1.eng: He then went to the Jain ascetic from Ñātika and said,
pli-tv-kd6:31.2.1.comm: Bhikkhu Sujāto has this to say about the name Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta: “(The Ñātika clan) were perhaps the second-most important of the clans that made up the Vajjian League (after the Licchavīs), yet there is little information about them, and they seem almost absent from the Pali texts. One of the rather noteworthy aspects of the clan is how variable the spelling of their name is. We find Jṇātṛika or Jṇātaka in Sanskrit; Ñātaka in Pali, Nāyika in Jain Prakrit, and well as Nāṭaka, and so on. The variety of forms and dialectical variations is forbidding, but it appears that the sense of the word is simply “the clan”, i.e. it is ñāti as in “family”. By far the most famous member of the clan was Mahāvīra, the leader of the Jains. In Pali, he is known as Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta. The latter name is explained by the commentary as “son of a dancer”; it is also sometimes spelled Nāthaputta (son of a lord). However given the universal Jain tradition that he was a Jṇātṛika, it seems certain that this is a misunderstanding, and that Nāṭaputta in fact means “a son of the Jṇātṛi clan”, i.e. a Jṇātṛika. It is the same pattern as Sākyaputta, which means “Sakyan”. Given this, perhaps we should reconsider how we present his name. Nigaṇṭha means “knotless”, but it is just a term for a Jain ascetic (as bhikkhu is for Buddhists). Perhaps we should translate his name as “the Jain monk of the Ñātika clan.” See full discussion at https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/the-lost-vajjian-clan-of-the-natikas.

pli-tv-kd6:31.2.2.eng: “Sir, I wish to visit the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.2.3.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, sīha, kiriyavādo samāno akiriyavādaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi?
pli-tv-kd6:31.2.3.eng: “But Sīha, why visit the ascetic Gotama who believes that actions don’t have results when you believe that they do?

pli-tv-kd6:31.2.4.pli: Samaṇo hi, sīha, gotamo akiriyavādo akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.2.4.eng: For the ascetic Gotama believes in inaction, teaches that, and trains his disciples in that.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.2.5.pli: Atha kho sīhassa senāpatissa yo ahosi gamikābhisaṅkhāro bhagavantaṃ dassanāya, so paṭippassambhi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.2.5.eng: Sīha’s intention to go died down.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.1.pli: Dutiyampi kho abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī sandhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.3.1.eng: The same sequence of events happened a second time.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, tathā hime abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī sandhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.4.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.5.pli: Dutiyampi kho sīho senāpati yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.7.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, sīha, kiriyavādo samāno akiriyavādaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi?

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.8.pli: Samaṇo hi, sīha, gotamo akiriyavādo akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.9.pli: Dutiyampi kho sīhassa senāpatissa yo ahosi gamikābhisaṅkhāro bhagavantaṃ dassanāya, so paṭippassambhi.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.10.pli: Tatiyampi kho abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī sandhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.3.10.eng: A third time a number of well-known Licchavīs were seated together in the public hall, praising the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha in many ways.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.11.eng: Sīha heard this, and he had the same thoughts as before.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.12.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, tathā hime abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī sandhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.13.pli: Kiñhi me karissanti nigaṇṭhā apalokitā vā anapalokitā vā?
pli-tv-kd6:31.3.13.eng: And it occurred to him, “What can the Jain ascetics do to me, whether I get their permission or not?

pli-tv-kd6:31.3.14.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ anapaloketvāva nigaṇṭhe taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.3.14.eng: Let me go and visit the Buddha, the Perfected and fully Awakened One, without getting permission from the Jains.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati pañcahi rathasatehi divādivassa vesāliyā niyyāsi bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
pli-tv-kd6:31.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards, in the middle of the day, General Sīha set out from Vesālī with five hundred carriages to visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.2.pli: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.4.2.eng: He went by carriage as far as the ground would allow, dismounted, and then approached the Buddha on foot. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.4.pli: “sutaṃ me taṃ, bhante—‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.4.4.eng: “Sir, I have heard that the ascetic Gotama believes in inaction, that he teaches inaction, and that he trains his disciples in that.

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.5.pli: Ye te, bhante, evamāhaṃsu—‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.6.pli: Kacci te, bhante, bhagavato vuttavādino, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākaronti, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchati?
pli-tv-kd6:31.4.6.eng: do they say what you have said without falsely misrepresenting you? Do they explain according to the Teaching so that they can’t be legitimately criticized?

pli-tv-kd6:31.4.7.eng: I don’t wish to misrepresent you.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.1.pli: “Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.5.1.eng: “There’s a way, Sīha, one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.2.pli: akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.5.2.eng: that I believe in inaction, that I teach inaction, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.3.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.4.pli: kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo kiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.5.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.6.pli: ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo ucchedāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.7.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.8.pli: jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.9.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.10.pli: venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.11.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.12.pli: tapassī samaṇo gotamo, tapassitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.13.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.14.pli: apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.15.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.5.16.pli: assattho samaṇo gotamo, assāsāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.2.pli: akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, akiriyaṃ vadāmi kāyaduccaritassa vacīduccaritassa manoduccaritassa;
pli-tv-kd6:31.6.3.eng: I teach the non-doing of misconduct by body, speech, and mind.

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.4.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ akiriyaṃ vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.6.4.eng: I teach the non-doing of the various kinds of bad and unwholesome actions.

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.6.pli: akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.7.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.6.7.eng: There’s also a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.8.pli: kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, kiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
pli-tv-kd6:31.6.8.eng: that I believe in action, that I teach action, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.9.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, kiriyaṃ vadāmi kāyasucaritassa vacīsucaritassa manosucaritassa, anekavihitānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ kiriyaṃ vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.6.9.eng: I teach the doing of good conduct by body, speech, and mind. I teach the doing of the various kinds of good and wholesome actions.

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.6.11.pli: kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, kiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.1.eng: There’s a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.2.pli: ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo, ucchedāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
