pli-tv-kd6:31.7.2.eng: that I’m an annihilationist, that I teach for the sake of annihilation, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, ucchedaṃ vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa;
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.3.eng: I teach the annihilation of sensual desire, ill will, and confusion.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.4.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ucchedaṃ vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.4.eng: I teach the annihilation of the various kinds of bad and unwholesome qualities.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.6.pli: ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo ucchedāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.7.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.7.eng: There’s a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.8.pli: jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.8.eng: that I’m disgusting, that I teach for the sake of disgust, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.8.comm: The literal meaning is “Good Gotama is disgusted,” but I am taking literary license to make it more meaningful and punchy. Sp 1.7: Puna brāhmaṇo “jigucchati maññe samaṇo gotamo idaṁ vayovuḍḍhānaṁ abhivādanādikulasamudācārakammaṁ, tena taṁ na karotī”ti maññamāno bhagavantaṁ jegucchīti āha, “Again, the brahmin says ‘The Buddha is disgusted’ because he thinks, ‘It seems the ascetic Gotama is disgusted with doing the wholesome actions of bowing down, etc., to elders.’” The brahmin clearly didn’t approve of such conduct, perhaps even finding it disgusting.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.9.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, jigucchāmi kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena;
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.9.eng: I am disgusted by misconduct by body, speech, and mind.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.10.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā jigucchāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.7.10.eng: I am disgusted by the various kinds of bad and unwholesome qualities.

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.7.12.pli: jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.1.eng: There’s a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.2.pli: venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.2.eng: that I’m an exterminator, that I teach for the sake of extermination, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, vinayāya dhammaṃ desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa;
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.3.eng: I teach the extermination of sensual desire, ill will, and confusion,

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.4.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ vinayāya dhammaṃ desemi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.4.eng: the extermination of the various kinds of bad and unwholesome qualities.

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.6.pli: venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.7.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.7.eng: There’s a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.8.pli: tapassī samaṇo gotamo, tapassitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.8.eng: that I’m austere, that I teach for the sake of austerity, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.9.pli: Tapanīyāhaṃ, sīha, pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi—
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.9.eng: I say that bad, unwholesome qualities—

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.10.eng: misconduct by body, speech, and mind—are to be disciplined.

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.11.pli: Yassa kho, sīha, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṃ tapassīti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.11.eng: One who has abandoned them, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, eradicated them, and made them incapable of reappearing in the future—such a one I call austere.

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.12.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, sīha, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
pli-tv-kd6:31.8.12.eng: Indeed the Buddha has abandoned the bad, unwholesome qualities that are to be disciplined, has cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, eradicated them, and made them incapable of reappearing in the future.

pli-tv-kd6:31.8.13.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya tapassī samaṇo gotamo tapassitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.1.eng: There’s a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.2.pli: apagabbho samaṇo gotamo apagabbhatāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.2.eng: that I’m retiring, that I teach for the sake of retiring, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.2.comm: “Retiring” renders apagabbha, explained in the commentaries, at Sp 1.10, as: Gabbhato apagatoti apagabbho, “Apagabbha means departed from the womb.” However, there is an alternative, and perhaps more convincing, derivation of this word. According to SED, in Vedic Sanskrit we find the word apagalbha in the meaning “wanting in boldness” or “timid”. It seems possible, then, that we here have a play on words, where the brahmin refers to “timid” whereas the Buddha responds according to the meaning “departed from the womb” or “retired from rebirth”. I have used the word “retiring” in an attempt at catching this pun.

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.3.pli: Yassa kho, sīha, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṃ apagabbhoti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.3.eng: One who has retired from any future conception in a womb, any rebirth in a future life, who has cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, eradicated it, and made it incapable of reappearing in the future—such a one I call retiring.

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.4.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, sīha, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.4.eng: Indeed the Buddha’s future conception in a womb, his rebirth in a future life, is abandoned and cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, eradicated, and incapable of reappearing in the future.

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.6.pli: apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.7.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.7.eng: There’s a way one could rightly say of me

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.8.pli: assattho samaṇo gotamo assāsāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.8.eng: that I’m at ease, that I teach for the sake of ease, and that I train my disciples in that. What’s that way?

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.9.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, assattho paramena assāsena, assāsāya dhammaṃ desemi, tena ca sāvake vinemi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.9.9.eng: I’m at ease in the highest sense, I proclaim my Teaching for the sake of ease, and I train my disciples in that.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd6:31.9.11.pli: assattho samaṇo gotamo assāsāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.1.eng: When the Buddha had finished, Sīha exclaimed,

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.2.eng: “Wonderful, sir, wonderful! Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways. I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.3.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.3.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.4.pli: “Anuviccakāraṃ kho, sīha, karohi; anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ sādhu hotī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.4.eng: “Consider it carefully, Sīha. It’s good for well-known people such as yourself to reflect carefully.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.5.pli: “Imināpāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṃ maṃ bhagavā evamāha—
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.5.eng: “Now I’m even more pleased with you, sir.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.6.pli: ‘anuviccakāraṃ kho, sīha, karohi; anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ sādhu hotī’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.7.pli: Mamañhi, bhante, aññatitthiyā sāvakaṃ labhitvā kevalakappaṃ vesāliṃ paṭākaṃ parihareyyuṃ—‘sīho kho amhākaṃ senāpati sāvakattaṃ upagato’ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.7.eng: Had I become a lay follower of another religion, they would’ve carried a banner all over Vesālī to proclaim it.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.8.pli: Atha ca pana maṃ bhagavā evamāha—

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.9.pli: ‘anuviccakāraṃ kho, sīha, karohi; anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ sādhu hotī’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.10.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, dutiyampi bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.10.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:31.10.11.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.10.11.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.1.pli: “Dīgharattaṃ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṃ opānabhūtaṃ kulaṃ, yena nesaṃ upagatānaṃ piṇḍakaṃ dātabbaṃ maññeyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.1.eng: “For a long time, Sīha, your family has been a wellspring of support for the Jain ascetics. When they come to you, you should still consider giving them almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.2.pli: “Imināpāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṃ maṃ bhagavā evamāha—
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.2.eng: “Now I’m even more pleased with you, sir.

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.3.pli: ‘dīgharattaṃ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṃ opānabhūtaṃ kulaṃ, yena nesaṃ upagatānaṃ piṇḍakaṃ dātabbaṃ maññeyyāsī’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.4.pli: Sutaṃ me taṃ, bhante, samaṇo gotamo evamāha—
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.4.eng: I had heard that you say

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.5.pli: ‘mayhameva dānaṃ dātabbaṃ, na aññesaṃ dānaṃ dātabbaṃ; mayhameva sāvakānaṃ dānaṃ dātabbaṃ, na aññesaṃ sāvakānaṃ dānaṃ dātabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.5.eng: that offerings should only be given to you and your disciples, not to anyone else,

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.6.pli: mayhameva dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ, na aññesaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ; mayhameva sāvakānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ, na aññesaṃ sāvakānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalan’ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.6.eng: and only offerings given to you and your disciples are fruitful, not what’s given to others.

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.7.pli: Atha ca pana maṃ bhagavā nigaṇṭhesupi dāne samādapeti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.7.eng: But in reality you encourage me to give to the Jain ascetics.

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.8.pli: Api ca, bhante, mayamettha kālaṃ jānissāma.
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.8.eng: Indeed, I shall know the right time for that.

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.9.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, tatiyampi bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.9.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:31.11.10.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.11.10.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sīhassa senāpatissa anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:31.12.1.eng: The Buddha then gave Sīha a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation. When the Buddha knew that his mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path. And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly, so too, while he was sitting right there, Sīha experienced the stainless vision of the Truth: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.” He had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. He had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.3.eng: He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.4.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.12.4.eng: “Sir, Please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.5.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.6.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.12.6.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Sīha got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.7.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati aññataraṃ purisaṃ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.9.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.12.9.eng: The following morning Sīha had various kinds of fine foods prepared. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:31.12.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sīhassa senāpatissa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:31.12.10.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to General Sīha’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṃ rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ bāhā paggayha kandanti—
pli-tv-kd6:31.13.1.eng: Just then a number of Jain ascetics were walking around Vesālī, from street to street, from intersection to intersection, waiving their arms and calling out,

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.2.pli: “ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṃ pasuṃ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṃ kataṃ, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.13.2.eng: “General Sīha has killed a large animal and made a meal for the ascetic Gotama. The ascetic Gotama is eating that meat, knowing that the animal was killed for his sake!”

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.3.pli: Atha kho aññataro puriso yena sīho senāpati tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā sīhassa senāpatissa upakaṇṇake ārocesi—
pli-tv-kd6:31.13.3.eng: A certain man went up to Sīha and whispered to him what the Jains were doing.

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.4.pli: “yagghe, bhante, jāneyyāsi, ete sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṃ rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ bāhā paggayha kandanti—

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.5.pli: ‘ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṃ pasuṃ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṃ kataṃ, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman’”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.6.pli: “Alaṃ, ayyo, dīgharattampi te āyasmantā avaṇṇakāmā buddhassa, avaṇṇakāmā dhammassa, avaṇṇakāmā saṅghassa;
pli-tv-kd6:31.13.6.eng: Sīha said, “Forget about it. For a long time those venerables have wanted to disparage the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.7.pli: na ca pana te āyasmantā jiridanti taṃ bhagavantaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhantā;
pli-tv-kd6:31.13.7.eng: They’ll grow old and still keep on misrepresenting the Buddha with lies.

pli-tv-kd6:31.13.8.pli: na ca mayaṃ jīvitahetupi sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropeyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.13.8.eng: Besides, I wouldn’t kill a living being even for the sake of my life.”

pli-tv-kd6:31.14.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.14.1.eng: Sīha then personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Sīha sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:31.14.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho sīhaṃ senāpatiṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:31.14.2.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:31.14.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:31.14.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:31.14.4.eng: “You shouldn’t eat meat when you know the animal was killed for your sake.

pli-tv-kd6:31.14.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd6:31.14.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tikoṭiparisuddhaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ—adiṭṭhaṃ assutaṃ aparisaṅkitan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:31.14.6.eng: I allow you to eat meat and fish that’s pure in three respects: you haven’t seen, heard, or suspected that the animal was killed for your sake.”

pli-tv-kd6:32.1.0.eng: 20. The allowance for a food-storage area

pli-tv-kd6:32.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesālī subhikkhā hoti susassā sulabhapiṇḍā, sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:32.1.1.eng: Some time later in Vesālī, there was plenty of food, the crops were abundant, and there was no problem getting by on almsfood.

pli-tv-kd6:32.1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavato rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd6:32.1.2.eng: Then, while the Buddha was reflecting in private, he thought,

pli-tv-kd6:32.1.3.pli: “yāni tāni mayā bhikkhūnaṃ anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabhapiṇḍe anto vuṭṭhaṃ anto pakkaṃ sāmaṃ pakkaṃ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṃ tato nīhaṭaṃ purebhattaṃ paṭiggahitaṃ vanaṭṭhaṃ pokkharaṭṭhaṃ, ajjāpi nu kho tāni bhikkhū paribhuñjantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:32.1.3.eng: “Those things I allowed the monks when there was a shortage of food, the crops were meager, and it was hard to get by on alms—that is, what’s been stored indoors in a monastery, what’s been cooked indoors in a monastery, what’s been cooked by the monks themselves, what’s been received after picking it up, what’s been brought out, what’s been received before the meal, what’s come from the forest or a lotus pond—do the monks still make use of these?”

pli-tv-kd6:32.1.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:32.1.4.eng: When the Buddha had come out from seclusion, he asked Venerable Ānanda about this.

pli-tv-kd6:32.1.5.pli: “yāni tāni, ānanda, mayā bhikkhūnaṃ anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabhapiṇḍe anto vuṭṭhaṃ anto pakkaṃ sāmaṃ pakkaṃ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṃ tato nīhaṭaṃ purebhattaṃ paṭiggahitaṃ vanaṭṭhaṃ pokkharaṭṭhaṃ, ajjāpi nu kho tāni bhikkhū paribhuñjantī”ti?

pli-tv-kd6:32.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:32.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:32.2.2.pli: “yāni tāni, bhikkhave, mayā bhikkhūnaṃ anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabhapiṇḍe anto vuṭṭhaṃ anto pakkaṃ sāmaṃ pakkaṃ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṃ tato nīhaṭaṃ purebhattaṃ paṭiggahitaṃ vanaṭṭhaṃ pokkharaṭṭhaṃ, tānāhaṃ ajjatagge paṭikkhipāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:32.2.2.eng: “Those things I allowed you when there was a shortage of food, the crops were meager, and it was hard to get by on alms, I prohibit from today onward.

pli-tv-kd6:32.2.3.pli: Na, bhikkhave, anto vuṭṭhaṃ anto pakkaṃ sāmaṃ pakkaṃ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:32.2.3.eng: You shouldn’t eat what’s been stored indoors in a monastery, what’s been cooked indoors in a monastery, what’s been cooked by yourselves, or what’s been received after picking it up.

pli-tv-kd6:32.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd6:32.2.5.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, tato nīhaṭaṃ purebhattaṃ paṭiggahitaṃ vanaṭṭhaṃ pokkharaṭṭhaṃ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:32.2.5.eng: If you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, you shouldn’t eat non-leftovers that have been brought out, that have been received before the meal, or that have come from the forest or a lotus pond.

pli-tv-kd6:32.2.6.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd6:33.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena jānapadā manussā bahuṃ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi sakaṭesu āropetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake sakaṭaparivaṭṭaṃ karitvā acchanti—“yadā paṭipāṭiṃ labhissāma, tadā bhattaṃ karissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:33.1.1.eng: At that time people from the country loaded much salt, oil, rice, and fresh food onto carts, brought them to outside the monastery gatehouse, and waited for their turn to cook a meal.

pli-tv-kd6:33.1.2.eng: Just then a storm was approaching.

pli-tv-kd6:33.1.3.pli: Atha kho te manussā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavocuṃ—“idha, bhante ānanda, bahuṃ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi sakaṭesu āropitā tiṭṭhanti, mahā ca megho uggato; kathaṃ nu kho, bhante ānanda, paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:33.1.3.eng: Those people went to Venerable Ānanda and told him what was happening, adding, “What should we do now?”

pli-tv-kd6:33.1.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd6:33.1.4.eng: Ānanda told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.1.pli: “Tena hānanda, saṅgho paccantimaṃ vihāraṃ kappiyabhūmiṃ sammannitvā tattha vāsetu, yaṃ saṅgho ākaṅkhati vihāraṃ vā aḍḍhayogaṃ vā pāsādaṃ vā hammiyaṃ vā guhaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd6:33.2.1.eng: “Well then, Ānanda, the Sangha should designate a building at the edge of the monastery as a food-storage area and then store the food there—whether a dwelling, a stilt house, or a cave.
pli-tv-kd6:33.2.1.comm: “Stilt house” combines aḍḍhayoga, pāsāda, and hammiya in one word. All of these, according to the commentaries, are different kinds of pāsāda, “stilt houses”. Rather than try to differentiate between these buildings, which is unlikely to be useful from a practical perspective, I have instead grouped them together as “stilt house”. Here is what the commentaries have to say. Sp 4.294: Aḍḍhayogoti supaṇṇavaṅkagehaṁ, “An aḍḍhayoga is a house bent like a supaṇṇa.” Sp-ṭ 4.294 clarifies: Supaṇṇavaṅkagehanti garuḷapakkhasaṇṭhānena katagehaṁ, “Supaṇṇavaṅkageha: a house made in the shape of the wings of a garuḷa.” A garuḷa, better known in its Sanskrit form garuḍa, is a mythological bird. Sp 4.294 continues: Pāsādoti dīghapāsādo. Hammiyanti upariākāsatale patiṭṭhitakūṭāgāro pāsādoyeva, “A pāsāda is a long stilt house. A hammiya is just a pāsāda that has an upper room on top of its flat roof.” At Sp-ṭ 3.74, however, we find slightly different explanations. Still, it seems clear that all three are stilt houses and that they are distinguished according to their shape and the kind of roof they possess. For an explanation of the rendering “stilt house” for pāsāda, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.2.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.3.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.4.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ vihāraṃ kappiyabhūmiṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd6:33.2.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should designate such-and-such a dwelling as a food-storage area.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.7.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.8.eng: The Sangha designates such-and-such a dwelling as a food-storage area.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.9.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa vihārassa kappiyabhūmiyā sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd6:33.2.9.eng: Any monk who approves of designating such-and-such a dwelling as a food-storage area should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.10.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.11.eng: The Sangha has designated such-and-such a dwelling as a food-storage area.

pli-tv-kd6:33.2.12.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:33.2.12.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd6:33.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā tattheva sammutiyā kappiyabhūmiyā yāguyo pacanti, bhattāni pacanti, sūpāni sampādenti, maṃsāni koṭṭenti, kaṭṭhāni phālenti.
pli-tv-kd6:33.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards people used the designated food-storage area for various purposes: to cook congee and rice, to prepare curries, to chop meat, and to split firewood.

pli-tv-kd6:33.3.2.pli: Assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya uccāsaddaṃ mahāsaddaṃ kākoravasaddaṃ, sutvāna āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:33.3.2.eng: Getting up early in the morning, the Buddha heard loud noises, like the cawing of crows. He asked Venerable Ānanda what was going on,

pli-tv-kd6:33.3.3.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so, ānanda, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo kākoravasaddo”ti?

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.1.pli: “Etarahi, bhante, manussā tattheva sammutiyā kappiyabhūmiyā yāguyo pacanti, bhattāni pacanti, sūpāni sampādenti, maṃsāni koṭṭenti, kaṭṭhāni phālenti.

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.2.pli: So eso, bhagavā, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo kākoravasaddo”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:33.4.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.4.eng: “You shouldn’t use a designated food-storage area.
pli-tv-kd6:33.4.4.comm: The sequence of events suggests the following: (1) The Buddha initially allows a dwelling (vihāra) to be used as a food storage area. (2) In the present rule he then disallows this. (3) Finally, in the next rule, he allows certain other buildings to be used in this way.

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.6.eng: I allow three places as food-storage areas:

pli-tv-kd6:33.4.7.eng: a building made according to a proclamation, a cow stall, and a building given for the purpose by a householder.”

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā yasojo gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:33.5.1.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Yasoja was sick.

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.3.eng: and the monks stored them outside.

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.4.eng: Vermin ate them and thieves stole them.

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.6.eng: “I allow you to use a designated food-storage area.

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.7.eng: I allow four places as food-storage areas:

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.8.eng: a building made according to a proclamation, a cow stall, a building given for the purpose by a householder, and a building designated by the Sangha.”
pli-tv-kd6:33.5.8.comm: The commentary explains these terms as follows. First the “building made according to a proclamation”. Sp 3.295: Paṭhamathambhaṁ pana paṭhamabhittipādaṁ vā patiṭṭhāpentehi bahūhi samparivāretvā “kappiyakuṭiṁ karoma, kappiyakuṭiṁ karomā”ti vācaṁ nicchārentehi manussesu ukkhipitvā patiṭṭhāpentesu āmasitvā vā sayaṁ ukkhipitvā vā thambhe vā bhittipādo vā patiṭṭhāpetabbo, “After the many who are installing have surrounded the first pillar or the first base for a wall, after extolling among people by saying, ‘We are making a food-store’, having touched those who are installing or oneself having extolled, the base of the wall is to be established or at a pillar.” The details are not entirely clear, but the main point seems to be that one announces in the presence of others that one is building a food-store. Next the “cow stall”. Sp 3.295: Ettha kappiyakuṭiṁ laddhuṁ vaṭṭati, “To obtain a food-store here is allowable.” Sp 3.295: Gahapatīti manussā āvāsaṁ katvā “kappiyakuṭiṁ dema, paribhuñjathā”ti vadanti, “‘A building given for the purpose by a householder’: having made a building, the people say, ‘We give a food-store, please use it.’” Sp 3.295: Sammutikā nāma kammavācaṁ sāvetvā katāti, “What is constructed/designated after making an official proclamation in the Sangha is called ‘a building designated by the Sangha’.”

pli-tv-kd6:33.5.9.eng: The fourth section for recitation on Sīha is finished.

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.0.eng: 21. The account of the householder Meṇḍaka

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd6:34.1.1.eng: At that time in the town of Bhaddiya there was a householder called Meṇḍaka

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.3.pli: sīsaṃ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṃ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṃ pūreti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.1.3.eng: He would wash his hair, sweep out his granary, and sit down outside the door. A shower of grain would then fall out of the sky and fill his granary.

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.4.eng: His wife, too, had supernormal powers.

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.5.pli: ekaṃyeva āḷhakathālikaṃ upanisīditvā ekañca sūpabhiñjanakaṃ dāsakammakaraporisaṃ bhattena parivisati, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.1.5.eng: She would sit down next to a pot of rice and a pot of curry and serve a meal to the slaves, servants, and workers. The food would not be exhausted until she got up.

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.6.eng: His son, too, had supernormal powers.

pli-tv-kd6:34.1.7.pli: ekaṃyeva sahassathavikaṃ gahetvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṃ vetanaṃ deti, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāvassa hatthagatā.
pli-tv-kd6:34.1.7.eng: He would get a bag containing a thousand coins and give the slaves, servants, and workers their wages for six months. That purse would not go empty as long as he held it.

pli-tv-kd6:34.2.1.eng: His daughter-in-law, too, had supernormal powers.

pli-tv-kd6:34.2.2.pli: ekaṃyeva catudoṇikaṃ piṭakaṃ upanisīditvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṃ bhattaṃ deti, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.2.2.eng: She would sit down next to a four-liter basket and give out rice for six months to the slaves, servants, and workers. The rice would not be exhausted until she got up.
pli-tv-kd6:34.2.2.comm: Catudoṇika piṭaka, “A basket with a capacity of four doṇas.” According to T. W. Rhys Davids in “On the Ancient Coins and Measures of Ceylon: with a discussion of the Ceylon date of the Buddha’s death”, p. 18, one doṇa is equivalent to 64 handfuls. It may well be that this amounts to more than one liter, but given the uncertainty one liter seems like a suitably round number.

pli-tv-kd6:34.2.3.eng: Even his slave had supernormal powers.

pli-tv-kd6:34.2.4.pli: ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.2.4.eng: While plowing with a single plow, he made seven furrows.

pli-tv-kd6:34.3.1.pli: Assosi kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro—

pli-tv-kd6:34.3.2.pli: “amhākaṃ kira vijite bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd6:34.3.2.eng: heard that within his kingdom, in the town of Bhaddiya, there was a householder called Meṇḍaka with all these abilities.

pli-tv-kd6:34.3.4.pli: sīsaṃ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṃ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṃ pūreti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.3.6.pli: ekaṃyeva āḷhakathālikaṃ upanisīditvā ekañca sūpabhiñjanakaṃ dāsakammakaraporisaṃ bhattena parivisati, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.3.8.pli: ekaṃyeva sahassathavikaṃ gahetvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṃ vetanaṃ deti, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāvassa hatthagatā.

pli-tv-kd6:34.4.2.pli: ekaṃyeva catudoṇikaṃ piṭakaṃ upanisīditvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṃ bhattaṃ deti, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.4.4.pli: ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.5.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro aññataraṃ sabbatthakaṃ mahāmattaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:34.5.1.eng: The king told the official in charge of practical affairs about this,

pli-tv-kd6:34.5.2.pli: “amhākaṃ kira, bhaṇe, vijite bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati.

pli-tv-kd6:34.5.4.pli: sīsaṃ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṃ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṃ pūreti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.5.8.pli: dāsassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo, ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchantīti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.5.10.pli: Yathā mayā sāmaṃ diṭṭho, evaṃ tava diṭṭho bhavissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.5.10.eng: If you see it, it will be as if I see it myself.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.5.11.pli: “Evaṃ, devā”ti kho so mahāmatto rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paṭissuṇitvā caturaṅginiyā senāya yena bhaddiyaṃ tena pāyāsi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.5.11.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he set out for Bhaddiya with the fourfold army.

pli-tv-kd6:34.6.1.pli: Anupubbena yena bhaddiyaṃ yena meṇḍako gahapati tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā meṇḍakaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:34.6.1.eng: When he eventually arrived, he went up to Meṇḍaka and said,

pli-tv-kd6:34.6.3.pli: ‘amhākaṃ kira, bhaṇe, vijite bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati, tassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo, sīsaṃ nahāyitvā …pe…

pli-tv-kd6:34.6.7.pli: dāsassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo, ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchantīti, gaccha, bhaṇe, jānāhi.

pli-tv-kd6:34.6.8.pli: Yathā mayā sāmaṃ diṭṭho, evaṃ tava diṭṭho bhavissatī’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.6.10.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati sīsaṃ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṃ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdi, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṃ pūresi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.6.10.eng: Meṇḍaka then washed his hair, swept out his granary, and sat down outside the door. A shower of grain fell out of the sky and filled his granary.

pli-tv-kd6:34.6.12.eng: Now show me your wife’s supernormal powers.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.7.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhariyaṃ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd6:34.7.2.eng: “Please serve a meal to the fourfold army.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.7.3.pli: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhariyā ekaṃyeva āḷhakathālikaṃ upanisīditvā ekañca sūpabhiñjanakaṃ caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ bhattena parivisi, na tāva taṃ khiyyati, yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.7.3.eng: She sat down next to a pot of rice and a pot of curry and served a meal to the fourfold army. The food was not exhausted until she got up.

pli-tv-kd6:34.7.5.eng: Now show me your son’s supernormal powers.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.8.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati puttaṃ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd6:34.8.2.pli: “tena hi caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṃ vetanaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.8.2.eng: “Please give wages for six months to the fourfold army.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.8.3.pli: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa putto ekaṃyeva sahassathavikaṃ gahetvā caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṃ vetanaṃ adāsi, na tāva taṃ khiyyati, yāvassa hatthagatā.
pli-tv-kd6:34.8.3.eng: He got a bag containing a thousand coins and gave the fourfold army its wages for six months. That purse did not go empty as long as he held it.

pli-tv-kd6:34.8.5.eng: Now show me your daughter-in-law’s supernormal powers.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati suṇisaṃ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.2.pli: “tena hi caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṃ bhattaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.9.2.eng: “Please give rice for six months to the fourfold army.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.3.pli: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa suṇisā ekaṃyeva catudoṇikaṃ piṭakaṃ upanisīditvā caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṃ bhattaṃ adāsi, na tāva taṃ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.9.3.eng: She sat down next to a four-liter basket and gave rice for six months to the fourfold army. The rice was not exhausted until she got up.

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.5.eng: Now show me your slave’s supernormal powers.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.6.pli: “Mayhaṃ kho, sāmi, dāsassa iddhānubhāvo khette passitabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.9.6.eng: “Sir, we have to go to the field to see that.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.7.eng: “Forget about it, then. I consider it as seen.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.8.pli: Atha kho so mahāmatto caturaṅginiyā senāya punadeva rājagahaṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.9.8.eng: That official then returned to Rājagaha with the fourfold army

pli-tv-kd6:34.9.9.pli: Yena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.9.9.eng: and told the king what had happened.

pli-tv-kd6:34.10.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena bhaddiyaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.10.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Vesālī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Bhaddiya with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:34.10.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena bhaddiyaṃ tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd6:34.10.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane.
pli-tv-kd6:34.10.3.eng: he stayed in the Jātiyā Grove.

pli-tv-kd6:34.11.2.pli: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito bhaddiyaṃ anuppatto bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane.
pli-tv-kd6:34.11.2.eng: “Sir, the ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan, who has gone forth from the Sakyan clan, has arrived at Bhaddiya and is staying in the Jātiyā Grove with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:34.11.3.pli: Taṃ kho pana bhagavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato—
pli-tv-kd6:34.11.3.eng: That good Gotama has a fine reputation:

pli-tv-kd6:34.11.4.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’.
pli-tv-kd6:34.11.4.eng: ‘He is a Buddha, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:34.11.5.pli: So imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.11.5.eng: With his own insight he has seen this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, and he makes it known to others.

pli-tv-kd6:34.11.6.pli: So dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.11.6.eng: He has a Teaching that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end. It has a true goal and is well articulated. He sets out a perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.’

pli-tv-kd6:34.11.7.pli: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṃ arahataṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.11.7.eng: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.12.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhadraṃ bhadraṃ yānaṃ abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi yānehi bhaddiyā niyyāsi bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
pli-tv-kd6:34.12.1.eng: Meṇḍaka then had his best carriages harnessed, mounted one of them, and set out from Bhaddiya to visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd6:34.12.2.pli: Addasaṃsu kho sambahulā titthiyā meṇḍakaṃ gahapatiṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ, disvāna meṇḍakaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:34.12.2.eng: A number of monastics from other religions saw Meṇḍaka coming, and they said to him,

pli-tv-kd6:34.12.4.eng: “I’m going to visit the Buddha, sir, the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.12.5.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, gahapati, kiriyavādo samāno akiriyavādaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi?
pli-tv-kd6:34.12.5.eng: “But why visit the ascetic Gotama who believes that actions don’t have results when you believe that they do?

pli-tv-kd6:34.12.6.pli: Samaṇo hi, gahapati, gotamo akiriyavādo akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.12.6.eng: For the ascetic Gotama believes in inaction, teaches that, and trains his disciples in that.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.2.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, yathayime titthiyā usūyantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.13.2.eng: “No doubt he must be a Buddha, a Perfected and fully Awakened One, since these monastics of other religions are jealous.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.3.pli: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.13.3.eng: He then went by carriage as far as the ground would allow, dismounted, and then approached the Buddha on foot. After bowing down to the Buddha, he sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnassa kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:34.13.4.eng: and the Buddha gave him a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.5.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation. When the Buddha knew that his mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path. And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly, so too, while he was sitting right there, Meṇḍaka experienced the stainless vision of the Truth: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.” He had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. He had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.6.eng: He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.7.eng: “Wonderful, sir, wonderful! Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways. I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.8.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:34.13.8.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.9.pli: Adhivāsetu ca me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.13.9.eng: And please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.13.10.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:34.14.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.14.1.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Meṇḍaka got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:34.14.2.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.14.2.eng: The following morning Meṇḍaka had various kinds of fine foods prepared and then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:34.14.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena meṇḍakassa gahapatissa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:34.14.3.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Meṇḍaka’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:34.15.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhariyā ca putto ca suṇisā ca dāso ca yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:34.15.1.eng: Then Meṇḍaka’s wife, son, daughter-in-law, and slave approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd6:34.15.2.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:34.15.2.eng: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk,

pli-tv-kd6:34.15.3.eng: just as he had done to Meṇḍaka. They, too, experienced the stainless vision of the Truth,

pli-tv-kd6:34.15.4.eng: and they expressed their appreciation in the same way

pli-tv-kd6:34.15.6.pli: ete mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.

pli-tv-kd6:34.15.7.pli: Upāsake no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṃ gate”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.16.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:34.16.1.eng: Meṇḍaka then personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Meṇḍaka sat down to one side and said,

pli-tv-kd6:34.16.2.pli: “yāva, bhante, bhagavā bhaddiye viharati tāva ahaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dhuvabhattenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.16.2.eng: “Sir, as long as you’re staying in Bhaddiya, I would like to offer a regular meal to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.16.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā meṇḍakaṃ gahapatiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.16.3.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:34.17.0.eng: 22. The allowance for the five products of a cow, etc.

pli-tv-kd6:34.17.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bhaddiye yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā meṇḍakaṃ gahapatiṃ anāpucchā yena aṅguttarāpo tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.17.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Bhaddiya for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Aṅguttarāpa with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks. He had not informed Meṇḍaka.

pli-tv-kd6:34.17.3.pli: “bhagavā kira yena aṅguttarāpo tena cārikaṃ pakkanto mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.17.4.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati dāse ca kammakare ca āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-kd6:34.17.4.eng: he told his slaves and workers,

pli-tv-kd6:34.17.5.pli: “tena hi, bhaṇe, bahuṃ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi sakaṭesu āropetvā āgacchatha, aḍḍhatelasāni ca gopālakasatāni aḍḍhatelasāni ca dhenusatāni ādāya āgacchantu, yattha bhagavantaṃ passissāma tattha taruṇena khīrena bhojessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.17.5.eng: “Load lots of salt, oil, rice, and fresh food onto the carts, and bring along twelve-hundred and fifty cowherds and twelve-hundred and fifty dairy cows. We’ll give the Buddha fresh milk wherever we see him.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṃ antarāmagge kantāre sambhāvesi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.18.1.eng: Meṇḍaka caught up with the Buddha while he was crossing a wilderness area.

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.2.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.18.2.eng: Meṇḍaka approached the Buddha, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.4.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.18.4.eng: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.5.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.6.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.18.6.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Meṇḍaka bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd6:34.18.7.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.18.7.eng: The following morning Meṇḍaka had various kinds of fine foods prepared and then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:34.19.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena meṇḍakassa gahapatissa parivesanā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:34.19.1.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Meṇḍaka’s meal offering where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:34.19.2.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati aḍḍhatelasāni gopālakasatāni āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-kd6:34.19.2.eng: Meṇḍaka told the twelve-hundred and fifty cowherds,

pli-tv-kd6:34.19.3.pli: “tena hi, bhaṇe, ekamekaṃ dhenuṃ gahetvā ekamekassa bhikkhuno upatiṭṭhatha taruṇena khīrena bhojessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.19.3.eng: “Listen, bring one cow for each and every monk and give them fresh milk.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.19.4.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi, taruṇena ca khīrena.
pli-tv-kd6:34.19.4.eng: Meṇḍaka then personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha, and he gave them fresh milk.

pli-tv-kd6:34.19.5.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not accept.
pli-tv-kd6:34.19.5.comm: It’s not clear why they refused to accept the milk.

pli-tv-kd6:34.19.6.eng: The Buddha said, “Accept, monks, and drink.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.20.1.pli: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā taruṇena ca khīrena bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.20.1.eng: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Meṇḍaka sat down to one side,

pli-tv-kd6:34.20.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:34.20.3.pli: “santi, bhante, maggā kantārā, appodakā appabhakkhā, na sukarā apātheyyena gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:34.20.3.eng: “Sir, there are wilderness roads where there is little water and little food, where it’s not easy to travel without provisions.

pli-tv-kd6:34.20.4.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ pātheyyaṃ anujānātū”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:34.20.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā meṇḍakaṃ gahapatiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:34.20.5.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened Meṇḍaka with a teaching, after which he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.3.eng: milk, curd, buttermilk, butter, and ghee.

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.4.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, maggā kantārā appodakā appabhakkhā, na sukarā apātheyyena gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.4.eng: There are wilderness roads where there’s little water and little food, where it’s not easy to travel without provisions.

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pātheyyaṃ pariyesituṃ taṇḍulo taṇḍulatthikena, muggo muggatthikena, māso māsatthikena, loṇaṃ loṇatthikena, guḷo guḷatthikena, telaṃ telatthikena, sappi sappitthikena.
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.5.eng: I allow you to look for provisions: whatever you need of rice, mung beans, black gram, salt, sugar, oil, and ghee.

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.6.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, manussā, saddhā pasannā, te kappiyakārakānaṃ hatthe hiraññaṃ upanikkhipanti—
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.6.eng: There are people who have faith and confidence. They may deposit money with an attendant, saying,
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.6.comm: “Money” renders hirañña. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.7.eng: “With this, please get something allowable for the venerable.”

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yaṃ tato kappiyaṃ taṃ sādituṃ;
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.8.eng: I allow you to consent to anything allowable from that fund.

pli-tv-kd6:34.21.9.pli: na tvevāhaṃ, bhikkhave, kenaci pariyāyena jātarūparajataṃ sāditabbaṃ pariyesitabbanti vadāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.9.eng: But I say that under no circumstances should you look for or consent to gold, silver, or money.”
pli-tv-kd6:34.21.9.comm: “Gold, silver, and money” renders jātarūparajata. For a discussion of this compound, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd6:35.1.0.eng: 23. The account of Keṇiya the dreadlocked ascetic

pli-tv-kd6:35.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena āpaṇaṃ tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd6:35.1.1.eng: Wandering on, the Buddha eventually arrived at Āpaṇa.

pli-tv-kd6:35.1.3.pli: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito āpaṇaṃ anuppatto, taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato …pe…
pli-tv-kd6:35.1.3.eng: “The ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan, who’s gone forth from the Sakyan clan, has arrived at Āpaṇa.” And he heard about the Buddha’s qualities just as Meṇḍaka had.

pli-tv-kd6:35.1.4.pli: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṃ arahataṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:35.1.6.pli: “kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ samaṇassa gotamassa harāpeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:35.1.6.eng: “What should I take to the ascetic Gotama?”

pli-tv-kd6:35.2.2.pli: “yepi kho te brāhmaṇānaṃ pubbakā isayo mantānaṃ kattāro mantānaṃ pavattāro, yesamidaṃ etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇaṃ mantapadaṃ gītaṃ pavuttaṃ samihitaṃ, tadanugāyanti tadanubhāsanti, bhāsitamanubhāsanti, vācitamanuvācenti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:35.2.2.eng: “There are those ancient sages of the brahmins, the creators and teachers of the Vedas,

pli-tv-kd6:35.2.3.pli: aṭṭhako vāmako vāmadevo vessāmitto yamataggi aṅgīraso bhāradvājo vāseṭṭho kassapo bhagu, rattūparatā viratā vikālabhojanā, te evarūpāni pānāni sādiyiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:35.2.3.eng: that is, Aṭṭhaka, Vāmaka, Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta, Yamataggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, and Bhagu. The brahmins at present still sing and proclaim the ancient verses that they sang, proclaimed, and collected. Now those ancient sages abstained from eating at night and at the wrong time, yet they consented to certain drinks.

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.1.pli: Samaṇopi gotamo rattūparato virato vikālabhojanā, arahati samaṇopi gotamo evarūpāni pānāni sādiyitun”ti
pli-tv-kd6:35.3.1.eng: The ascetic Gotama also abstains from eating at night and at the wrong time. It would be appropriate for him to consent to the same drinks.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.2.pli: pahūtaṃ pānaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā kājehi gāhāpetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi;
pli-tv-kd6:35.3.2.eng: He then had a large quantity of drinks prepared. Lifting them with carrying poles, he went to the Buddha. He exchanged pleasantries with the Buddha

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.3.pli: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.6.eng: “Please give them to the monks, Keṇiya.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.7.pli: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhikkhūnaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.8.eng: but being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not accept them.

pli-tv-kd6:35.3.9.eng: The Buddha said, “Accept, monks, and drink.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.4.1.pli: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pahūtehi pānehi sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ dhotahatthaṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:35.4.1.eng: Keṇiya then personally served that large quantity of drinks to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Keṇiya sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:35.4.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho keṇiyaṃ jaṭilaṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd6:35.4.2.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching,

pli-tv-kd6:35.4.3.pli: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:35.4.4.pli: “adhivāsetu me bhavaṃ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:35.4.4.eng: “Good Gotama, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.1.pli: “Mahā kho, keṇiya, bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni, tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:35.5.1.eng: “The Sangha is large, Keṇiya. There are twelve hundred and fifty monks. And you have faith in the brahmins.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.2.pli: Dutiyampi kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:35.5.2.eng: Keṇiya acknowledged what the Buddha had said,

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.3.pli: “kiñcāpi kho, bho gotama, mahā bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni, ahañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno, adhivāsetu me bhavaṃ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:35.5.3.eng: but repeated his invitation a second time.

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.4.pli: “Mahā kho, keṇiya, bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni, tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.5.pli: Tatiyampi kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:35.5.5.eng: and Keṇiya repeated his invitation a third time.

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.6.pli: “kiñcāpi kho, bho gotama, mahā bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni, ahañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno, adhivāsetu bhavaṃ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.7.eng: The Buddha then consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd6:35.5.8.pli: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:35.5.8.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Keṇiya got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:35.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:35.6.3.pli: ambapānaṃ jambupānaṃ cocapānaṃ mocapānaṃ madhūkapānaṃ muddikapānaṃ sālūkapānaṃ phārusakapānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.3.eng: mango drinks, rose-apple drinks, drinks from bananas with seeds, drinks from seedless bananas, licorice drinks, grape drinks, drinks made from lotus tubers, and falsa fruit drinks.
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.3.comm: Sp 3.300: Cocapānanti aṭṭhikehi kadaliphalehi katapānaṁ, “Cocapāna: a drink made with plantain fruits that have seeds.” Sp 3.300: Mocapānanti anaṭṭhikehi kadaliphalehi katapānaṁ, “Mocapāna: a drink made with seedless plantain fruit.” Madhūkapāna is literally “a drink from the honey tree (fruit)”, Bassia latifolia or Madhuca longifolia. Sp 3.300: Madhukapānanti madhukānaṁ jātirasena katapānaṁ, “Madhukapāna: a drink made with the natural juice from honey tree fruits.” This might also refer to sap from the honey tree. Sp 3.300: Muddikapānanti muddikā udake madditvā ambapānaṁ viya katapānaṁ, “Muddikapāna: having crushed grapes in water, it is a drink made like a mango drink.” Sp 3.300: Sālūkapānanti rattuppalanīluppalādīnaṁ sālūke madditvā katapānaṁ, “Sālūkapāna: a drink made by having crushed the tubers of red lotuses and blue water lilies.” SED identifies the phārusakapāna as the Grewia Asiatica, sv. parūsha. Sp 3.300: Phārusakapānanti phārusakaphalehi ambapānaṁ viya katapānaṁ, “Phārusakapāna: a drink made like a mango drink but with phārusaka fruits.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.6.4.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbaṃ phalarasaṃ ṭhapetvā dhaññaphalarasaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.4.eng: I allow juice from all fruits, except grain.

pli-tv-kd6:35.6.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbaṃ pattarasaṃ ṭhapetvā ḍākarasaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.5.eng: I allow juice from all leaves, except the leaves of potherbs.

pli-tv-kd6:35.6.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbaṃ puppharasaṃ ṭhapetvā madhūkapuppharasaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.6.eng: I allow juice from all flowers, except licorice flowers.

pli-tv-kd6:35.7.1.pli: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena sake assame paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:35.7.1.eng: The following morning Keṇiya had various kinds of fine foods prepared in his own hermitage and then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-kd6:35.7.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assamo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd6:35.7.2.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Keṇiya’s hermitage where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd6:35.7.3.pli: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:35.7.3.eng: Keṇiya then personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Keṇiya sat down to one side,

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho keṇiyaṃ jaṭilaṃ bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi—
pli-tv-kd6:35.8.1.eng: and the Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses:

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.3.comm: “Meter” refers to the rhythmical pattern of verse. Pali, and presumably other Indian languages, divide syllables into two categories, long and short. The meter then specifies the pattern of long and short syllables in a line of verse. The Sāvittī meter mentioned here will have a particular patten of such syllables.

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.4.eng: A king is the best of humans,

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.5.eng: The ocean the chief of rivers.

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.6.eng: The moon is the best in the night sky,

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.7.eng: The sun the best of all that shines.

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.8.eng: But for those making offerings, desiring merit,

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.9.eng: The Sangha is indeed the best.”

pli-tv-kd6:35.8.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā keṇiyaṃ jaṭilaṃ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:35.8.10.eng: And the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:36.1.0.eng: 24. The account of Roja the Mallian

pli-tv-kd6:36.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āpaṇe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena kusinārā tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Āpaṇa for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Kusinārā with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:36.1.2.pli: Assosuṃ kho kosinārakā mallā—“bhagavā kira kusināraṃ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.1.2.eng: When the Mallians of Kusinārā heard that the Buddha was coming,

pli-tv-kd6:36.1.3.pli: Te saṅgaraṃ akaṃsu—“yo bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ na karissati, pañcasatānissa daṇḍo”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.1.3.eng: they made an agreement that whoever did not go out to meet the Buddha would be fined five hundred coins.

pli-tv-kd6:36.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rojo mallo āyasmato ānandassa sahāyo hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.1.4.eng: At that time Venerable Ānanda had a friend called Roja the Mallian.

pli-tv-kd6:36.1.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena kusinārā tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd6:36.1.5.eng: As the Buddha was approaching Kusinārā,

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.1.pli: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ akaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:36.2.1.eng: the Mallians, including Roja, went out to meet him.

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.2.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ karitvā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.2.2.eng: Roja then went to Ānanda and bowed,

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho rojaṃ mallaṃ āyasmā ānando etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.4.pli: “uḷāraṃ kho te idaṃ, āvuso roja, yaṃ tvaṃ bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ akāsī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.2.4.eng: “It’s noble of you to come out to meet the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.5.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhante ānanda, bahukato buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā;
pli-tv-kd6:36.2.5.eng: “I’m not doing this out of respect for the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.6.pli: api ca ñātīhi saṅgaro kato—‘yo bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ na karissati, pañcasatānissa daṇḍo’ti;

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.7.pli: so kho ahaṃ, bhante ānanda, ñātīnaṃ daṇḍabhayā evāhaṃ bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ akāsin”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.2.7.eng: because I would get fined by the Mallians if I didn’t.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.2.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando anattamano ahosi “kathañhi nāma rojo mallo evaṃ vakkhatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:36.2.8.eng: Ānanda was disappointed with his friend.

pli-tv-kd6:36.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.3.1.eng: He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd6:36.3.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd6:36.3.3.eng: “Sir, Roja the Mallian is a well-known person.

pli-tv-kd6:36.3.4.pli: Mahatthiko kho pana evarūpānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ imasmiṃ dhammavinaye pasādo.
pli-tv-kd6:36.3.4.eng: It’s of great benefit when such well-known people gain confidence in this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd6:36.3.5.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā tathā karotu, yathā rojo mallo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye pasīdeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.3.5.eng: Sir, please inspire confidence in Roja.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.3.6.pli: “Na kho taṃ, ānanda, dukkaraṃ tathāgatena, yathā rojo mallo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye pasīdeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.3.6.eng: “That’s not difficult for the Buddha, Ānanda.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rojaṃ mallaṃ mettena cittena pharitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.4.1.eng: The Buddha then suffused Roja with a mind of loving kindness, before getting up from his seat and entering his dwelling.

pli-tv-kd6:36.4.2.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo bhagavato mettena cittena phuṭṭho, seyyathāpi nāma gāviṃ taruṇavaccho;
pli-tv-kd6:36.4.2.eng: When Roja was suffused with loving kindness, he acted just like a young calf looking for its mother:

pli-tv-kd6:36.4.3.pli: evameva vihārena vihāraṃ pariveṇena pariveṇaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhū pucchati—
pli-tv-kd6:36.4.3.eng: he went from dwelling to dwelling, from yard to yard, asking,

pli-tv-kd6:36.4.4.pli: “kahaṃ nu kho, bhante, etarahi so bhagavā viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, dassanakāmā hi mayaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.4.4.eng: “Venerables, where’s the Buddha staying, the Perfected and fully Awakened One? I wish to see him.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.4.5.pli: “Esāvuso roja, vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭehi, vivarissati te bhagavā dvāran”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.4.5.eng: “In that dwelling, Roja, with the closed door. Go there quietly and slowly, enter the porch, clear your throat, and knock on the door. The Buddha will then open the door for you.”
pli-tv-kd6:36.4.5.comm: “Door” renders aggaḷa. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.1.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. Vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:36.5.1.eng: Roja did just that, and the Buddha opened the door for him.

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.2.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo vihāraṃ pavisitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.5.2.eng: He entered the dwelling, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnassa kho rojassa mallassa bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd6:36.5.3.eng: The Buddha then gave him a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.4.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation. When the Buddha knew that his mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path. And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly, so too, while he was sitting right there, Roja experienced the stainless vision of the Truth: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.” He had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. He had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.5.eng: He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.6.pli: “sādhu, bhante, ayyā mamaññeva paṭiggaṇheyyuṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ, no aññesan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.5.6.eng: “Sir, please have the venerables accept robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies from me, and not from others.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.7.pli: “Yesaṃ kho, roja, sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammo diṭṭho seyyathāpi tayā, tesampi evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd6:36.5.7.eng: “Roja, those who have seen the Truth with a trainee’s knowledge and vision, as you have, think like this.

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.8.pli: ‘aho nūna ayyā amhākaññeva paṭiggaṇheyyuṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ, no aññesan’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:36.5.9.pli: Tena hi, roja, tava ceva paṭiggahissanti aññesañcā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.5.9.eng: But listen, Roja, the monks will have to receive both from you and others.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kusinārāyaṃ paṇītānaṃ bhattānaṃ bhattapaṭipāṭi aṭṭhitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.1.eng: At this time in Kusinārā there was a succession of fine meals.

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.2.pli: Atha kho rojassa mallassa paṭipāṭiṃ alabhantassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.2.eng: Not being able to get a turn, Roja thought,

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.3.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ bhattaggaṃ olokeyyaṃ, yaṃ bhattagge nāssa, taṃ paṭiyādeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.3.eng: “Why don’t I inspect the dining hall and then prepare whatever is lacking?”

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.4.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo bhattaggaṃ olokento dve nāddasa—
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.4.eng: When he did, he saw that two things were missing:

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.5.eng: potherbs and fresh food made of flour.
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.5.comm: Sp 3.302: Piṭṭhakhādanīyanti piṭṭhamayaṁ khādanīyaṁ: “Piṭṭhakhādanīya: fresh food made from flour.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.6.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.6.eng: He then went to Venerable Ānanda and told him what he had been thinking,

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.7.pli: “idha me, bhante ānanda, paṭipāṭiṃ alabhantassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.8.pli: ‘yannūnāhaṃ bhattaggaṃ olokeyyaṃ, yaṃ bhattagge nāssa, taṃ paṭiyādeyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.9.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhante ānanda, bhattaggaṃ olokento dve nāddasaṃ—

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.11.pli: Sacāhaṃ, bhante ānanda, paṭiyādeyyaṃ ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca, paṭiggaṇheyya me bhagavā”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:36.6.11.eng: adding, “Venerable Ānanda, if I were to prepare potherbs and fresh food made of flour, would the Buddha accept it?”

pli-tv-kd6:36.6.12.eng: “Well, Roja, let me ask the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.7.1.eng: Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.3.eng: Ānanda passed the message on to Roja.

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.4.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo tassā rattiyā accayena pahūtaṃ ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato upanāmesi—
pli-tv-kd6:36.7.4.eng: The following morning Roja prepared many potherbs and much fresh food made with flour and brought it to the Buddha, saying,

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.5.eng: “Sir, please accept the potherbs and the fresh food made with flour.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.6.eng: “Well then, Roja, give it to the monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.7.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo bhikkhūnaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.8.eng: but being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-kd6:36.7.9.eng: The Buddha said, “Accept, monks, and eat.”

pli-tv-kd6:36.8.1.pli: Atha kho rojo mallo buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pahūtehi ḍākehi ca piṭṭhakhādanīyehi ca sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ dhotahatthaṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.8.1.eng: Roja then personally served many potherbs and much fresh food made with flour to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Roja sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd6:36.8.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rojaṃ mallaṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:36.8.2.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd6:36.8.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:36.8.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:36.8.4.eng: “I allow all potherbs and all fresh food made of flour.”

pli-tv-kd6:37.1.0.eng: 25. The account of the one who had gone forth when old

pli-tv-kd6:37.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kusinārāyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena ātumā tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:37.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Kusinārā for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Ātumā with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:37.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro vuḍḍhapabbajito ātumāyaṃ paṭivasati nahāpitapubbo.
pli-tv-kd6:37.1.2.eng: At that time at Ātumā there was a monk who was previously a barber and who had gone forth when old.

pli-tv-kd6:37.1.3.pli: Tassa dve dārakā honti, mañjukā paṭibhāneyyakā, dakkhā pariyodātasippā sake ācariyake nahāpitakamme.
pli-tv-kd6:37.1.3.eng: He had two boys, sweet-voiced and articulate, who were skilled barbers.
pli-tv-kd6:37.1.3.comm: Sp 3.303: Dve dārakāti sāmaṇerabhūmiyaṁ ṭhitā dve puttā, “Dve dārakā: two sons who were novice monks.”

pli-tv-kd6:37.2.1.pli: Assosi kho so vuḍḍhapabbajito—“bhagavā kira ātumaṃ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:37.2.1.eng: The monk who had gone forth when old heard that the Buddha was coming to Ātumā,

pli-tv-kd6:37.2.2.pli: Atha kho so vuḍḍhapabbajito te dārake etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:37.2.2.eng: and he said to those boys,

pli-tv-kd6:37.2.3.pli: “bhagavā kira, tātā, ātumaṃ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd6:37.2.3.eng: “The Buddha is coming to Ātumā with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

pli-tv-kd6:37.2.4.pli: Gacchatha tumhe, tātā, khurabhaṇḍaṃ ādāya nāḷiyāvāpakena anugharakaṃ anugharakaṃ āhiṇḍatha, loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi saṃharatha, bhagavato āgatassa yāgupānaṃ karissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:37.2.4.eng: Now go and get the barber equipment, and then go from house to house with a box and collect salt, oil, rice, and fresh food. When the Buddha has arrived, we’ll make a congee drink.”

pli-tv-kd6:37.3.1.pli: “Evaṃ, tātā”ti kho te dārakā tassa vuḍḍhapabbajitassa paṭissuṇitvā khurabhaṇḍaṃ ādāya nāḷiyāvāpakena anugharakaṃ anugharakaṃ āhiṇḍanti, loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi saṃharantā.

pli-tv-kd6:37.3.2.pli: Manussā te dārake mañjuke paṭibhāneyyake passitvā yepi na kārāpetukāmā tepi kārāpenti, kārāpetvāpi bahuṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd6:37.3.2.eng: When people saw those sweet-voiced and articulate boys, they used their services even if they did not really want to. And they gave much in return.

pli-tv-kd6:37.3.3.pli: Atha kho te dārakā bahuṃ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi saṃhariṃsu.
pli-tv-kd6:37.3.3.eng: Soon the boys had collected a large amount of salt, oil, rice, and fresh food.

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena ātumā tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd6:37.4.1.eng: When the Buddha eventually arrived at Ātumā,

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā ātumāyaṃ viharati bhusāgāre.
pli-tv-kd6:37.4.2.eng: he stayed in a dwelling made of husk.
pli-tv-kd6:37.4.2.comm: Sp-ṭ 3.303: Bhusāgāreti bhusamaye agārake, “Bhusāgāre: a house made of husk.”

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.3.pli: Atha kho so vuḍḍhapabbajito tassā rattiyā accayena pahūtaṃ yāguṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato upanāmesi—
pli-tv-kd6:37.4.3.eng: The following morning that monk who had gone forth when old had much congee prepared and brought it to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.5.eng: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not. They know the right time to ask and when not to ask. Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, otherwise they do not, for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial. Buddhas question the monks for two reasons:

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.6.eng: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ vuḍḍhapabbajitaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd6:37.4.7.eng: The Buddha then said to him,

pli-tv-kd6:37.4.9.pli: Atha kho so vuḍḍhapabbajito bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-kd6:37.5.2.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:37.5.2.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd6:37.5.3.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, pabbajito akappiye samādapessasi.
pli-tv-kd6:37.5.3.eng: How can you who have gone forth encourage others in what’s unallowable?

pli-tv-kd6:37.5.5.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd6:37.5.5.eng: After rebuking him, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd6:37.5.6.pli: “na, bhikkhave, pabbajitena akappiye samādapetabbaṃ, yo samādapeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd6:37.5.6.eng: “You shouldn’t encourage others to do what’s unallowable. If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd6:37.5.7.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, nahāpitapubbena khurabhaṇḍaṃ pariharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd6:37.5.7.eng: And if you were previously a barber, you shouldn’t carry barber equipment around.

pli-tv-kd6:37.5.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd6:38.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ātumāyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd6:38.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Ātumā for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd6:38.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd6:38.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd6:38.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd6:38.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ bahuṃ phalakhādanīyaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd6:38.1.4.eng: At that time in Sāvatthī there was much fruit.
pli-tv-kd6:38.1.4.comm: It is not immediately clear whether there was much fruit in general or whether the Sangha had received much fruit. Normally the word uppanna is construed with the genitive of the recipient. Since in this case there is no genitive, we can only assume that the fruit had not (yet) been given to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd6:38.1.6.pli: “kiṃ nu kho bhagavatā phalakhādanīyaṃ anuññātaṃ, kiṃ ananuññātan”ti?
pli-tv-kd6:38.1.6.eng: “Which fruits has the Buddha allowed and which not?”

pli-tv-kd6:39.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghikāni bījāni puggalikāya bhūmiyā ropiyanti, puggalikāni bījāni saṅghikāya bhūmiyā ropiyanti.
pli-tv-kd6:39.1.1.eng: On one occasion seeds belonging to the Sangha had been planted on land belonging to an individual and seeds belonging to an individual on land belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd6:39.1.3.pli: “Saṅghikāni, bhikkhave, bījāni puggalikāya bhūmiyā ropitāni bhāgaṃ datvā paribhuñjitabbāni.
pli-tv-kd6:39.1.3.eng: “If seeds belonging to the Sangha have been planted on land belonging to an individual, that person should be given a share, and the produce may then be eaten.
pli-tv-kd6:39.1.3.comm: Sp 3.304: Bhāgaṁ datvāti dasamabhāgaṁ datvā; idaṁ kira jambudīpe porāṇakacārittaṁ, tasmā dasakoṭṭhāse katvā eko koṭṭhāso bhūmisāmikānaṁ dātabbo, “Bhāgaṁ datvā: having given a tenth part. They say this is the ancient custom in India. Therefore, having divided it into ten parts, one part is to be given to the owner of the land.”

pli-tv-kd6:39.1.4.pli: Puggalikāni bījāni saṅghikāya bhūmiyā ropitāni bhāgaṃ datvā paribhuñjitabbānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd6:39.1.4.eng: If seeds belonging to an individual have been planted on land belonging to the Sangha, the Sangha should be given a share, and the produce may then be eaten.”

pli-tv-kd6:40.1.0.eng: 26. Discussion of the four great standards
